speaker: Marth
text: What is this strange air? It feels like it's full of evil spirits.

speaker: Jagen
text: That is true... My body appears to be frozen. These are the evil spirits of the Earth Dragons. Your highness, it seems we can't have everybody enter ahead. Since we don't know what will happen, please choose carefully who to take with you.

speaker: Marth
text: I hope to at least take the people who are worried about the four sisters.

speaker: Jagen
text: Mmm... There's no avoiding that. But how many people will survive? I bet this will be a fierce battle.

speaker: Gotoh
text: Prince Marth. The altar is probably full of crazed barbarians and Mage Dragons that have lost their mind. They are being controlled by Gharnef's magic, and will definitely attack you. The dark priests that serve Gharnef also have fearful power. As this battle lengthens it will become fiercer, but don't stop and keep charging forwards! You must defeat Gharnef, and recover from him the divine Falchion sword that was stolen from Altea. Without the Falchion, you won't be able to defeat Medeus...

speaker: Jagen
text: Your highness, the wall in front of us has collapsed!

speaker: Samson
text: Princess Sheena, it seems the Altean army has arrived.

speaker: Sheena
text: Really...? It's already the end. Samson, I have brought you much trouble. I need to watch the final days of my Kingdom of Gra. You may leave now.

speaker: Samson
text: Princess, isn't it already enough? Shouldn't you despise King Jiol for forcefully taking your mother? Isn't that why you hid at Millennium Court and stayed away from this country? Right now you are just being tricked by Hardin, and being used by him.

speaker: Sheena
text: Perhaps. I heard that the people of Gra wished for the restoration of the country, and that's why I agreed to help him. However Hardin is only interested in using us. He would just throw us away like rubbish the moment we became useless to him. Still, I will not leave! How can I just abandon those fighting for my sake!?

speaker: Samson
text: Impossible... How can our fresh recruits resist Altea's elites...? Fine, if you're staying, I will also stay to the end. This could be interesting.

speaker: Sheena
text: Samson... Why are you doing this? Aren't you mercenaries only interested in being paid with gold? I no longer have money to give you...

speaker: Samson
text: I don't know why either. It's just... Sometimes men feel like there are things that they must do. Also, I want to see how that kid fights this battle. If he truly is a hero, perhaps your mind may be changed...

speaker: Old Man
text: Hardin sent troops here to prevent Gra from rebelling. The Archanea soldiers are the only ones that can still fight.

speaker: Woman
text: Princess Sheena is the child of King Jiol's second wife. But, she is different from the king. She is a very kind person. The princess is prepared to sacrifice her life for her soldiers. Is there no way to save her?

speaker: Woman
text: The soldiers here are all foreigners. There's nobody else to protect this country, because the knights of this country all died. Right now, the actions of the Archanea soldiers are deplorable. Their just the same as thieves... Those lowlifes!

speaker: Young Woman
text: Ah... Please leave me. I already have nothing to give you.

speaker: Marth
text: Ah, please don't get us wrong. We aren't here to steal.

speaker: Young Woman
text: But, didn't you all come here from Altea for revenge?

speaker: Marth
text: No, we don't want to fight Gra, because Gra and Altea were originally like one family.

speaker: Young Woman
text: Is that true...? Then, I will give my most important treasure... to... you

speaker: Sheena
text: You... You dare treat my citizens like that... Die!

speaker: Sheena
text: Forgive me, citizens of Gra.

speaker: Samson
text: Prince Marth... I thought you were a noble person, but you're just a murderer... You disappoint me.*

speaker: Samson
text: Sheena...

speaker: Marth
text: You are Princess Sheena? It's great to see you safe. I don't view Gra as an enemy. Gra and my country were originally one country. The country may have divided after Anri's death, but we always got on well as allies. But, in the previous war, I felt deeply regretful about things turning out the way they did. Princess Sheena, please allow us to be friends once again. I don't want to fight Gra.

speaker: Sheena
text: Prince Marth... Once I heard that you didn't attack my fleeing soldiers, I was really surprised. You truly are the second coming of King Anri. I trust you. Please... Treat the citizens of Gra... as if they were your citizens. I will hand my whole country to your care... Prince Marth.

speaker: Samson
text: That's great Sheena. Now I can finally leave without worry.

speaker: Sheena
text: Samson... Can you not leave...?

speaker: Samson
text: You don't need me anymore. From now on Prince Marth will protect you.

speaker: Sheena
text: Don't leave! I don't want you to leave...

speaker: Samson
text: Huh, what? Why keep me? It doesn't seem like you. ...Fine. If you say you need me, I won't go anywhere else. I will protect you wherever you may go. Is that fine with you?

speaker: Sheena
text: Yes...

speaker: Jagen
text: Lord Marth, if this battle continues it will become meaningless, and will only give more time for Hardin.

speaker: Marth
text: Mmm, I was thinking the same. If we keep heading east, more needless blood will be spilt. So I have decided a different route for us to go. How about we go directly south from Menedi, and enter Millennium Court from Adria Pass?

speaker: Jagen
text: You want the troops to cross that dangerous mountain path? It's too dangerous...

speaker: Marth
text: I am already prepared for danger. Besides, we were able to conquer the dangerous Anri's Way, so this should be easy in comparison...

speaker: Jagen
text: ...That's a fair point. If we can cross it, we can attack the enemy from the rear. Understood, we'll try that.

speaker: Gharnef
text: Come, boy, you want to stop me again? This time I won't spare you!!

speaker: Marth
text: Gharnef, give my sister and the others back!! Where have you taken them!?

speaker: Gharnef
text: Hahahaha... Those clerics are going to become sacrifices for the resurrection of the Shadow Dragon. They are lost forever. Soon the Earth Dragon King, Medeus, will be reborn in his true form, and we require the clerics as live sacrifices. However their souls shattered because they couldn't stand the pain. Not even I can help them now. Thanks to them, the Shadow Dragon will awaken. He no longer fears even the power of the Binding Shield. It's a shame that everything's already over. Marth... You will die here!!!

speaker: Gharnef
text: Hahahaha... Let me show you the might of my Imhullu spell...

speaker: Gharnef
text: Haha... It's already too late... This world is done for... Urgh.

speaker: Jagen
text: Your highness, there's a stairway leading up!!

speaker: Marth
text: ...! Isn't that my sister and the others!? Who are they protecting...? Damn... That's... Is that Medeus...?

speaker: Jagen
text: Wait, if the princesses are in the way, your highness' sword will be unable to strike. We must think of something fast, otherwise the Earth Dragons will awaken, and then they will be in even more pain.

speaker: Marth
text: What should I do...? How can I save them? Please tell me Jagen.

speaker: Jagen
text: That... Not even I know. To defeat Medeus there is probably no other way except to...

speaker: Marth
text: ...! What, you want me to kill them!?

speaker: Jagen
text: That is one way. The princess cannot suffer any more. Taking their life is also a way of saving them.

speaker: Marth
text: Jagen, are you SERIOUSLY telling me to make this decision?

speaker: Jagen
text: As leader, there are times when you must make painful decisions. That is what I meant.

speaker: Marth
text: Jagen, that's enough, I understand. I will not give up. There must be some other way. Until the very end, I will not give up!!

speaker: Cleric
text: THOSE WHO OPPOSE... LORD MEDEUS... MUST DIE...

speaker: Minerva
text: Maria! Please open your eyes. It's me, Minerva! Be strong!

speaker: Maria
text: Uh... Oh... Minerva, sister... Ahh, Medeus, he...

speaker: Minerva
text: Everything's alright now, relax. I'm sorry, Maria, for letting you experience all this...

speaker: Maria
text: Sister... I'm scared... so scared. Oh! How is brother? He fought with Gharnef to rescue me.

speaker: Minerva
text: Michalis, he... He's alright, Maria, don't worry.

speaker: Maria
text: Really? Then, when we return home, will we be like one big family again? That's great, sister. Oh, I really want to see brother again.

speaker: Minerva
text: Maria...

speaker: Sirius
text: Princess Nyna! Open your eyes! Be strong...!

speaker: Nyna
text: Ah... I made a huge mistake. Because of my stupidity... I caused such grief for Hardin. And I made him... turn into that. Oh... I... What should I do?

speaker: Sirius
text: Empress... Prince Marth has already ended Hardin's suffering. Even until the end Hardin still loved you, and he apologized for his crimes. It's alright now. You don't need to suffer anymore. You just had a bad dream, that's all...

speaker: Sirius
text: Princess Nyna! You mustn't give up. You shouldn't be a weak person!

speaker: Nyna
text: Ah...! You are... Camus...!? You are Camus!! Why... Why are you... Am I dreaming? You're still alive... Ah... It's true...

speaker: Sirius
text: .....! Empress... I think you're mistaken. I am Sirius, a soldier of the allied army. I don't know anybody called Camus...

speaker: Nyna
text: Sirius...!? ...How...? No! That's wrong!! You must be...

speaker: Sirius
text: Please calm down. You must be very tired. I must leave this place very soon. Well, Empress Nyna... You should return to Prince Marth's side...

speaker: Nyna
text: You... Where are you going?

speaker: Sirius
text: I must return to my country. I... I have somebody waiting there for me.

speaker: Nyna
text: Really, is that so? I understand... Sirius... thank you.

speaker: Sirius
text: It's... nothing... Empress, you must go!

speaker: Merric
text: Elice! It's me, Merric! Please open your eyes. I studied magic so that I could protect you... Yet I still couldn't do that, or be by your side... Elice... I'm begging you... Please open your eyes!

speaker: Elice
text: Merric...? ...! Oh, Merric! Save me... Gharnef, he... is so frightening... Please save me!

speaker: Merric
text: Elice! Great, you've finally awakened. It's alright now, I'm here. Oh... But Marth... and the others are watching... This is embarrassing. Elice, no matter what happens I won't leave your side again... Okay?

speaker: Julian
text: Miss Lena, wake up! It's me, Julian. What should I do? I know I'm a man with no merits, but for you I will do anything. I don't have any other wishes, I just want to see you smile, Miss Lena. Smile, I'm begging you, Miss Lena...

speaker: Lena
text: Oh... Julian... You did come. I believed that you would definitely come. So that's how I could endure the horrors that I faced... Julian, I'm sorry. I always acted like a spoiled brat to you.

speaker: Julian
text: No... Just hearing Miss Lena's words is enough for me.

speaker: Lena
text: Julian, can you listen to a request of mine?

speaker: Julian
text: Huh? Oh, please ask, as long as I can do it...

speaker: Lena
text: From now on, just call me Lena. It seems so impersonal when you call me Miss Lena. Because we're going to return to Macedon, to live together.

speaker: Julian
text: Huh? ...Miss Lena... Oh... No... I meant Le... na... Do you really mean that...

speaker: Lena
text: Mmm... I believe the deities will forgive me. Because of my... love for you.

speaker: Maria
text: Ah, Minerva, sister...

speaker: Nyna
text: Ah, Camus...

speaker: Elice
text: Ah, Merric...

speaker: Lena
text: Ah, Julian...

speaker: Medeus
text: I... HAVE RESURRECTED... STUPID HUMANS... I WILL KILL YOU ALL...

speaker: Medeus
text: HAHAHA... IT'S NOT OVER YET. YOUR NAIVETY... WILL DESTROY YOU... THOSE SISTERS WILL BE SACRIFICED... THEY WILL BECOME MY BLOOD AND MY FLESH... AND GIVE ME POWER!

speaker: Medeus
text: GWA...! WHY... WHY HAVE I... BEEN DEFEATED... SO EASILY...... IS THIS... THE POWER... OF NAGA'S... BINDING SHIELD...? BUT... HUMANS. DON'T FORGET... AS LONG AS GREED LIVES ON IN YOUR HEARTS... YOU WILL LOSE THE SHIELD AND I WILL RISE FROM THE EARTH ONCE AGAIN... REMEMBER... TH...IS...

speaker: Gotoh
text: Marth, courageous prince of Altea. Because of your efforts, the Dark Earth Dragon, Medeus, has finally been completely destroyed. Medeus's servants, the Earth Dragons have also vanished into the darkness. As long as the Binding Shield exists, they won't awaken anymore. Marth, descendant of Anri, and the chosen Prince of Light. You have saved mankind, and you have saved our dragon tribe...

speaker: Tiki
text: Marth!! I don't have to go back to the Ice Dragons' Temple anymore. I'm so happy! I really like everybody. I definitely don't want to live all by myself at that lonely place again. It's really... like a dream. I'm so happy, so very happy. Marth, I really like you!!

speaker: Marisha
text: Really Tiki... For how long do you plan on hogging Marth!? Honestly Marth, if you dare to show even the slightest happiness, Caeda won't forgive you.

speaker: Caeda
text: Marisha, you're talking nonsense again. However Marth really does look happy...

speaker: Marisha
text: He can finally put to rest his heavy burden. Lord Marth has always been carrying such a heavy responsibility. It must have been hard on him. But Caeda has also had it hard. There are so many people around Marth that finding a chance to even talk to him is difficult. You must have been lonely.

speaker: Caeda
text: Mmm... It doesn't matter. As long as Marth is safe, I wouldn't wish for anything else. I once prayed to the deities, since Marth had such an important mission. I prayed that if they decided his life was to be taken, to take my life in his place... That was all I could do.

speaker: Marisha
text: ..... Ah, Caeda truly can't be beaten. But you don't have to wait any longer. Because Lord Marth is about to return to your side. Look, Caeda, Marth is looking over there. Use your courage!

speaker: Caeda
text: Marth...

speaker: Marth
text: Caeda, it's finally over. I'm sorry for making you suffer.

speaker: Caeda
text: No, I couldn't help you one bit... I'm the one that should be sorry.

speaker: Marth
text: Don't be silly. It's only because I had Caeda that I was able to reach this day. Things will be more difficult from now onwards. The seven kingdoms of Archanea are going to be unified, and everybody is going to hand responsibility to me. But, such a task I cannot possibly do by myself. Caeda, I hope you can help me. I really need you.

speaker: Caeda
text: I... When I left Talys island, I already swore an oath. No matter where you went, I would be by your side. No matter what happened I would have faith in you. So, no matter what hardships there are, I can endure them. Because Marth... I lov...

speaker: Cain
text: Sire, you're safe!

speaker: Kris
text: Sir Cain! You made it!

speaker: Marth
text: I'm truly glad that you came back unharmed, Cain.

speaker: Cain
text: Yeah, somehow I managed to shake off the enemy and escape here. But the enemy is already approaching from the north.

speaker: Marth
text: Don't worry. We will crush them.

speaker: Cain
text: No, not this time. Hardin is being protected by a mysterious power: we can't lay a finger on him. So even if we fight him now, we haven't a chance of winning. Please, head to the northwestern fortress. There's a boat across the river, which we can use to escape to the Khadein desert.

speaker: Jagen
text: Sire, the free company to the south will probably make their move soon. Indeed, now's not the time to fight. For the time being, let's do as Cain suggests and make our escape. After that, we'll think of something...

speaker: Marth
text: I see... I don't like it, but we haven't a choice... Everyone, hurry to the northwest fortress!

speaker: Villager
text: If ya ask me, archers'll always get along well with archers.

speaker: Bantu
text: Oh look, if it isn't Prince Marth. Long time no see, Lad. It seems so noisy out; I wonder what's happened?

speaker: Marth
text: Ah, Bantu! Fancy meeting you in a place like this. How is Tiki?

speaker: Bantu
text: Oh, she is no longer by my side. Lord Gotoh took her to the Ice Dragon's Temple again.

speaker: Marth
text: The Ice Dragon's temple? Where's that? I've never heard of such a place...

speaker: Bantu
text: It's in the icy lands, far north of here. But it's no place for humans. Besides the hero Anri, no man has been there yet.

speaker: Marth
text: Anri?! Are you, perchance, referring to the "Realm of the Gods" from Anri's legends?

speaker: Bantu
text: I'm not at liberty to say anything more. If you want to know more, you should ask Lord Gotoh. Anyhow, I have a favor to ask of you. My precious firestone was stolen by thieves. If you can get it back for me, I'll show you how it works. Thank you, Prince Marth.

speaker: Hardin
text: Heh heh heh... Prince Marth, it's been far too long.

speaker: Marth
text: Hardin... Why did you attack our country? What would compel you to do such an act? I... I can't believe this. Have you really changed this much?

speaker: Hardin
text: Prince, I am the ruler of this continent and the Emperor of Archanea. I will show no quarter to anyone who opposes me. That includes you, Prince... I must destroy this foul world... It is beyond salvation. Traitors, playtime is over. You will all die here. All soldiers, attack! Do not leave a single traitor standing!

speaker: Gordin
text: Master! Please, wait!

speaker: Jeorge
text: Hm...? Gordin? Long time no see. You seem to have gotten a little sturdier, but has your bow arm improved any?

speaker: Gordin
text: Yes, at the moment, I... They call me Altea's master of bows. It's thanks to you, Master, that I've been able to progress this far.

speaker: Jeorge
text: And? Did you come here because you wanted to challenge your old teacher?

speaker: Gordin
text: N-no! It's not like that... ...I might be asking the impossible, but I'd like you to fight alongside us again, sir.

speaker: Gordin
text: Please! Master!!

speaker: Jeorge
text: I pledged allegiance to Princess Nyna, but as for Hardin... I've had it with him. Taking other countries by force, executing "rebels" without reason. The Archanean army I see now is just a collection of hired thugs. There's not even a shred of chivalry left. To return the kingdom of Archanea to what it was once before... I must take it upon myself to turn my bow against my homeland. Gordin. Convey that to Prince Marth.

speaker: Gordin
text: Thank you, Master!!

speaker: Astram
text: You traitors! I'll show you the might of Mercurius!!

speaker: Astram
text: Midia... My love...

speaker: Jeorge
text: You wouldn't have needed to die if you hadn't come so close, fools...

speaker: Jeorge
text: What fools...

speaker: Hardin
text: Rebel soldiers... Come to die, have you? I'll show you the terror of Gradivus!

speaker: Jagen
text: Please hurry, sire. The enemy is closing in on us.

speaker: Marth
text: But everyone is still fighting. I can't just leave them behind.

speaker: Jagen
text: Don't worry, everyone will escape safely and reunite with you at Khadein. Now sire, to the boat!

speaker: Marth
text: This place... It's incredible... I feel as though I'm burning up just by standing here.

speaker: Xane
text: This is Flame Barrel... The fire dragons' graveyard. It's where the fire dragons who've degenerated into savage beasts come to wait for their death.

speaker: Marth
text: Degenerated, you say...? What do you mean by that?

speaker: Xane
text: I'm not sure if you're aware, but the dragon tribe is dyin'. Those who don't confine their true, dragon form in a stone eventually lose all reason and become monsters.

speaker: Marth
text: So that's why they become Manaketes? Xane, if you know something about the dragon tribe, please tell me.

speaker: Xane
text: If you really wanna know... Tens of thousands of years ago, the dragon tribe settled down on this continent, and created a civilization. They possessed intellect and abilities far exceedin' those of humans. But suddenly, outta nowhere, their day of destruction came. At first, they couldn't bear children. Then they began to lose their minds, goin' berserk one after the next. The elders warned that the end of dragons as a species was approachin'. There was no longer any way to prevent it. However, there was one way they could survive: to discard their identities as dragons and live on as humans. The dragons fell into a panic. Those who believed the elders sealed their forms within stones and became humans. But those who couldn't throw away their pride as a dragon; those who adamantly refused to become human... They eventually lost their minds and became naught but beasts...

speaker: Marth
text: Those fire dragons before us...

speaker: Xane
text: Yeah, they're a livin' example. And it's not just them. There are many others. But they've all gone feral now. There's no way for them to go back... Worse still, they've been manipulated and degraded like cattle by the fire clans who rule over this valley. Well, princey. Whadya say we get out of here? The clansmen around here ain't friendly; if we hang around, we'll end up as bait for their dragon pets.

speaker: Xane
text: Phew! And that be the end of the fire dragons' valley. How you doin', princey?

speaker: Marth
text: I'm fine... I think. Xane, I believe you said that there were other feral dragon tribes.

speaker: Xane
text: Yeah. In addition to this valley, there's the Wyvern's Dale, the Ice Dragon Shrine and the Dragon's Altar...

speaker: Marth
text: The Dragon's Altar?

speaker: Xane
text: It's a dragon graveyard in the mountains of Macedon. There, the earth dragons sleep. A long time ago... Thousands of years ago in fact... The mighty earth dragons lost their minds and attacked the humans. 'Course, the humans barely stood a chance. Most were annihilated, and the rest pushed into the desolate corners of the continent. And then... the divine dragon Naga, strongest of them all, waged a war for humanity. It was a fierce battle, but Naga emerged victorious in the end, and sealed the earth dragons below Dolhr, in a deep sleep. And so that the power of the seal would not wither, she created the "shield of the five orbs" and placed it in the Fane of Raman.

speaker: Marth
text: I see... I understand now. In other words, our guardian deity Naga depicted in legend was the divine dragon that saved humanity. But then, what about the divine sword Falchion?

speaker: Xane
text: Naga took pity on you humans, with no way of protecting yourselves, so she created it from one of her fangs. Then, together with the shield, she sealed it in the fane, and had the remainin' dragon houses watch over humanity. She put the newly born Tiki to sleep and thus ended her 5,000-year life. 'Cause of all this, Gotoh's tryin' his best to carry out Naga's order.

speaker: Marth
text: Wait, Xane... Are you telling me...!?

speaker: Xane
text: Yes: Gotoh is a divine dragon. What, you thought it was just me?

speaker: Marth
text: Wa-wait, Xane. I still don’t understand. What exactly did you mean?

speaker: Xane
text: Phew, my throat is really dry. I can’t stand the heat anymore. Marth, let’s hurry along.

speaker: Ogma
text: Yuliya, Jubelo. This place is notorious for the Macedonian Vikings. If we could, we'd stay the hell away, but the village where Lord Wendell resides is just past this area.

speaker: Jubelo
text: Mister Ogma... I'm scared... Can we go back...?

speaker: Yuliya
text: Jubelo! Get a hold of yourself! You're a man, are you not? Show some spine! You can use a Fire tome, can't you? So... fight with it!

speaker: Jubelo
text: But Master Wendell said that we mustn't fight... Besides, I don't like fighting.

speaker: Yuliya
text: Ugh, stop complaining! It's just you and me now. You have to stay strong, because I... sniff... I don't know what we're supposed to do...

speaker: Jubelo
text: Oh... I'm sorry, Yuliya... I'll do my best, so... please don't cry!

speaker: Ogma
text: Damn... This can't be good... We've been spotted. Kids, we've got no choice; we're going to have to cut through. Do not leave my side!

speaker: Boy
text: D'you know of a staff called Rescue? I hear you can bring faraway allies right next to you in a flash! It'd be so cool if it were true!

speaker: Girl
text: Oh, those "Star Shards" are so shiny and pretty. If you hold on to them, something good might happen to you.

speaker: Villager
text: These days, all them bandits and pirates've been doin' as they please. Geez. This wouldn't 'ave 'appened if it weren't for all them political tomfoolery.

speaker: Villager
text: Oh, you're... you're... the prince of Altea! How nice of you to drop by, sir!

speaker: Marth
text: I heard Lord Wendell was living here.

speaker: Villager
text: Yes, that, er... was correct... Yesterday, a group of Archanean soldiers suddenly came and took the pontifex away. Although, Prince... He did leave his magic tome behind. I believe it's wind magic. Please, take it with you.

speaker: Marth
text: Well, if it isn't Castor! What brings you to a place like this?

speaker: Castor
text: Ah, Prince Marth! Erm... Actually, I need money for medicine for me sick mother. But I couldn't find any work in Talys, so I moved here instead.

speaker: Marth
text: I see... That's terrible... I do hope your mother gets better. Well, goodbye then...

speaker: Castor
text: ......... Wait!! Me mother, she's really sick... I need money, sir...

speaker: Marth
text: Hm? Oh right, here. It's only a little, but I hope it helps.

speaker: Castor
text: Uhm... Thank you, Prince Marth. You don't have to be so kind to a guy like me...

speaker: Marth
text: Castor... That's a bit much... It's only natural to help someone in need.

speaker: Castor
text: No, Prince Marth! You've done so much for me. I want to help you. Please, let me fight alongside you. You have my life at your disposal!!

speaker: Ogma
text: And just who the hell are you? Are you in league with the pirates?

speaker: Sirius
text: I am Sirius, a mere traveler.

speaker: Ogma
text: Oh, I see. I'm a little bit worked up right now. Sorry about the mix-up.

speaker: Sirius
text: Those children...

speaker: Ogma
text: I'm taking care of them. Do you know them?

speaker: Sirius
text: No, I don't... But I do know that, as things stand, you won't escape with them. As I understand it, the Altean army should arrive here, provided you reach the southern village. Please, allow me to distract the bandits, while you make your escape to safety.

speaker: Ogma
text: I see. So Prince Marth is here, eh? Got it, thanks. I've got to ask though. Why help a group of complete strangers like us?

speaker: Sirius
text: I want to save the children. That is... all.

speaker: Ogma
text: I see... Sirius... You said your name was Sirius, right? Let's meet again after we both get out of here! There's someone I need to take care of... The guy in charge of Grust's occupation, Commander Lang. I want to avenge a man named Lorenz... You--join me...! If I've got you on my side, then I'll be that much stronger.

speaker: Sirius
text: Yes... That would be interesting. But first, you have to survive. Hurry and go!

speaker: Sirius
text: Touch me and I'll strike you down.

speaker: Sirius
text: How foolish of me...

speaker: Guile
text: I'm sorry! ...I wasn't thinking! Gahaha, just kidding! I'll be smashing your pretty head in!!

speaker: Guile
text: I won't... forget this!

speaker: Caeda
text: Marth!!

speaker: Marth
text: Caeda? Did something happen? Why are you here?

speaker: Caeda
text: Marth... Altea... Altea was attacked by the imperial army. The Archanean League... Gra and Aurelis ambushed us. Our forces were annihilated and we lost the castle...

speaker: Marth
text: Wh-what did you say?! This can't be happening! Altea is... Jagen, what's going on?

speaker: Jagen
text: This is terrible beyond words... That which I feared the most has come to pass. Emperor Hardin likely heard Lang's story, and had us branded traitors.

speaker: Marth
text: I refuse to believe it. Hardin would never attack Altea! You're telling me that he believed Lang and truly thought that I wished to instigate a rebellion? Never!

speaker: Jagen
text: No, I agree with you, sire. This attack was too soon. It happened far too quickly. For an attack of this scale, a great number of preparations had to have been in place. It is likely... that the Grust campaign was a setup. As was the situation in Macedon. It's quite simple, really. They had you leave Altea, with your elite knights in tow, and then proceeded to attack our weakened defenses. Hardin had this planned right from the start.

speaker: Marth
text: That's preposterous! Are you implying that Hardin--with no provocation whatsoever--decided to attack his fellow nation? Are you seriously suggesting this was all an elaborate trap? No! I won't accept it... Hardin... why?

speaker: Jagen
text: Sire... Princess Caeda, what of the others? Is Princess Elice safe?

speaker: Caeda
text: Elice, she... She gave herself up in order to let me escape with this message. Marth... I'm so sorry. She wanted me to warn you, no matter what... Sniff...

speaker: Marth
text: Caeda... Don't cry. I understand. Just knowing you're safe makes me happy. I should be the one apologizing. I shouldn't have left... You needn't have to go through this. We will take back Altea. Even if we have to fight Hardin, we WILL reclaim our homeland!

speaker: Palla
text: Julian, good news! Catria finally brought the Altean army for us! We're going to join their ranks to help save Princess Minerva. Please take Lena and escape to safety, quickly!

speaker: Julian
text: No can do, Palla. Lena's disappeared... I'm not leaving by myself.

speaker: Palla
text: What? Lena as well... Princess Maria is missing too; why is it only clerics...?

speaker: Julian
text: Anyway, I'm staying in the village to see if I can't find any information. Sorry, Palla. Give my best to Prince Marth.

speaker: Villager
text: This is just between you and me, but I heard that armory is in league with the rebels. If you're going to enter you should be careful not to get jumped.

speaker: Villager
text: I wonder what's going to happen to Macedon? They say that Prince Michalis is dead, and Princess Maria is nowhere to be found... On top of that, they say that Princess Minerva has been captured and that her life is in peril. I just hope... that this country doesn't end up like Grust...

speaker: Villager
text: You know, a little while ago, a paladin came here; said he was on a journey. He was wearing a mask, but I'm sure that underneath, he was a good person. He was kind, yet wrapped in a veil of sorrow. I wonder if I'll ever see him again...

speaker: Villager
text: The pegasus knight trio must be lonely without Est. And I was such a fan of their "Triangle Attack!" too... Oh, Est... Come home already, will ya?

speaker: Villager
text: Have you noticed the large drawbridge behind this village? Normally it's separated by the river, but if you use this key here, you can cross the bridge. Just, once you cross the drawbridge, the enemies on the other side will come and attack you at once. If you want to advance safely, you might be better off taking the long detour that goes right around the mountain. Here, take the key. No matter which path you take, do take care of yourself, m'kay?

speaker: Julian
text: Hey, Prince, it's been a while, hasn't it? It's me, Julian!

speaker: Marth
text: Julian? I'd heard that you'd gone to Macedon with Lena, but to think we'd cross paths here... How is Lena? Of course, she's with you, right?

speaker: Julian
text: Well, er, how should I say this... Lena suddenly up and vanished... I... I don't know what to do.

speaker: Marth
text: Wait, Julian, tell me what happened, in detail.

speaker: Julian
text: Lena's been missing since last night. The villagers speak of some sort of strange priest prowling around lately. It seems that somehow, Lena was taken by this man.

speaker: Marth
text: A priest...? Julian, as it turns out, Princess Maria has gone missing as well. I have a terrible feeling about this. Anyway, staying here won't solve anything. Come with us. I'm worried for Lena, too. We'll all help to look for her.

speaker: Julian
text: Prince Marth... Thank you. Nothing would please me more.

speaker: Julian
text: Hey! Cut it out. Why must you always insist on pointing your sword at us? I pity Lena for having to put up with your stupidity.

speaker: Matthis
text: Oh, it's you, Julian. Are you still trying to worm your way into Lena's good books? No way, I won't hand my cute lil' sister to a thieving rat like you.

speaker: Julian
text: You can relax... Lena and I would never work out. But even if it's just a little, I wanted to help her in any way I could.

speaker: Matthis
text: Ooh, you finally realized where you stand. Attaboy, Julian!

speaker: Julian
text: Er, that's not the kind of thing I want to be hearing from you... Well, whatever. If you're worried about Lena, then come with me.

speaker: Matthis
text: Oh, alright, thanks. You see, they forced me to join the rebel army, but you know I hate fighting. Alright, lil' brother. Let's join forces and look for our cute lil' Lena!

speaker: Matthis
text: Lena... Where are you? What I would give to hear your voice just once before I die...

speaker: Matthis
text: Lena... F-forgive... your foolish big brother...

speaker: Rucke
text: D-damn it... Why is the Altean army here...? You're all going down with me. Die!

speaker: Rucke
text: The Altean knights... As I expected...

speaker: Jagen
text: Sire, the rebels have fled the castle, but I regret to inform you that Princess Minerva was nowhere to be found.

speaker: Marth
text: What could have happened? She was supposed to be held inside the castle...

speaker: Lang
text: Oh-hoh, I knew this task was unworthy. Excellent work, Prince Marth. We'll take care of Macedon from here. Now, let us discuss your next mission.

speaker: Marth
text: General Lang, what in the world do you want this time?

speaker: Lang
text: Well, you see... My castle was attacked and the Grustian prince and princess were kidnapped. The perpatrator fled to Macedon, it seems. Prince Marth, you are to capture him and return the children to me!

speaker: Marth
text: You're asking me to send those children to their doom!

speaker: Lang
text: You're in no position to defy me. Now, off to work you go, my prince.

speaker: Kris
text: You...! Your rudeness towards my liege has gone too far...! Shut up! Prince Marth is not your minion!

speaker: Lang
text: What did you say?! Know your place, Altean soldier! Marth, it seems that your countrymen are devoid of manners!

speaker: Marth
text: ...I apologize on his/her behalf. But it is as Kris says: General Lang, I will no longer follow your orders from here.

speaker: Kris
text: Sire...!

speaker: Lang
text: What! Do you mean to defy my orders?! I see... I see. As I suspected, it was YOUR doing. The person who kidnapped Grust's prince and princess was the mercenary, Ogma. On your orders, no less!

speaker: Marth
text: I didn't know of this. But if I had the choice, I would have done exactly as you suggested. Back at Grust, even though they were meant to be our enemies, I should have helped those children.

speaker: Lang
text: You! You clearly speak words of treason! Perhaps I should report this to the Emperor!

speaker: Marth
text: Do as you will. But you're not the only person who intends to visit the palace. I will speak to Emperor Hardin and Princess Nyna and inform them of your crimes. Forgive me, Jagen. But I cannot stand for this any longer.

speaker: Jagen
text: I understand. You have endured well until now. Lang, my liege might forgive your frequent rudeness to him, but I will not. Come, draw your sword. Even though I, Jagen, am old and senile, I will not lose to the likes of you.

speaker: Lang
text: Wh... what did you say?! Damn you... I'll remember this!! Once the Emperor gets wind of this, I'll crush your puny little Altea!

speaker: Marth
text: Jagen... you're a bag of surprises. To think you'd stand up against Lang like that.

speaker: Jagen
text: Sire, are you underestimating me in my old age? Bwahaha... I'm not about to let youngsters like Kris hog all the glory just yet. Still, I'll admit it was somewhat foolish to contest with Lang, even if he did push my lord at every turn.

speaker: Kris
text: Sire, Sir Jagen. What is our next plan of action?

speaker: Marth
text: According to Lang, Ogma is on his way to Macedon. He probably intends to visit the village where Lord Wendell resides.

speaker: Jagen
text: Understood. But, I worry about Lang... I pray that nothing bad shall happen...

speaker: Marth
text: I should have expected no less from Archanea. They have such a powerful army. We won't be able to get close so easily.

speaker: Jagen
text: Hardin is gambling everything on this one battle, and he appears to have gathered the entire army of Archanea here. But, any knights with a conscience already joined the coup and have nearly all been executed. All that remains are just weak mercenaries, so you don't need to fear them. Right now, many people hearts have already swayed from Hardin, and the citizens welcome us as their liberation army. This should give us confidence like no other. Anyway, this is the last battle. Although it might take time, please take care while advancing.

speaker: Marth
text: I understand. Let's go, Jagen. I am worried about Midia.

speaker: Woman
text: Emperor Hardin was once a kind man, but he suddenly changed into such a frightening Emperor... Ah... If I say things like this, I will get killed as well.

speaker: Young Man
text: Midia is the pride of Archanea. She was the daughter of th highest officer of Archanea, Duke Owen. This rebellion only came about because she could not stand and watch us suffer. No matter what, you must rescue her.

speaker: Young Woman
text: We thought that Nyna and Hardin's marriage would finally bring peace to the world, yet this happened. Oh deities... What should we do...?

speaker: Old Man
text: Midia is really pitiful. She only just retired as a knight to live together with Astram, and now she has been separated again. She's still a young girl, it's so sad. What can you do to help her...?

speaker: Man
text: The Archanea army has changed. The troops are all bloodthirsty savages now. What is going on with this country?

speaker: Old Man
text: Oh, this is so sad. Those that opposed Emperor Hardin have all been killed... Could the Emperor be possessed by a demon...?

speaker: Roshea
text: Prince Marth, I am Roshea of the Aruelis Knights. I have King Aurelis's permission to come here, and am awaiting your highness' orders. I am truly sorry for the battle at the pass. To apologize to you, I will join and fight alongside your army. Marth, please watch over me!

speaker: Nehring
text: What...? Our Archanea has been defeated? But as long as I'm here, I won't let you enter the castle!

speaker: Nehring
text: Glory to the Emperor...

speaker: Boah
text: Oh, Lord Marth. I've been waiting for you.

speaker: Marth
text: Boah!? You've suffered a grave wound... What happened?

speaker: Boah
text: Mmm... It was truly frightening... I suppose the Archanea royal family is indeed under a curse. You should know about Hardin and Nyna's marriage, two years ago. To restore Archanea, a king was required, and only two people were suitable. King Aurelis's younger brother, Hardin, and Altea's Prince Marth, you... Those were the choices, and we pleaded for Nyna to make the final decision. Originally, she wanted to wait a while longer, but we begged for her to make up her mind immediately. In the end she said that choosing Prince Marth as her husband would hurt Princess Caeda, so she finally decided on Hardin.

speaker: Marth
text: Wait a second, wasn't that a little harsh on Nyna? I understand that Archanea needed a king, but Nyna, she already...

speaker: Boah
text: You are referring to Grust's Lord Camus? But that would be unspeakable... Unthinkable in fact. Princess Nyna was the sole successor of the royal bloodline of Archanea. I felt bad as well, but for this country we had no other choice. However, Lord Hardin was very happy. Compared to ascending Archanea's throne, he seemed happier about the fact that Nyna chose him for her husband.

speaker: Marth
text: I also understand Hardin's feelings. He could sacrifice his own life for Nyna. But, did he know about Camus? If he did, I don't believe he would be so happy.

speaker: Boah
text: Mmm... Of course we kept that a secret, and we also persuaded Nyna to hide it as best as she could. But, Lord Hardin was a very sensitive man. He quickly found out that Nyna's heart had no place for him. He felt very painful... He locked himself in his room, and didn't allow anybody to see him. Taking advantage of his broken heart, Gharnef appeared. He took on the guise of a merchant to approach Hardin, and showed him the Darksphere. The distraught Hardin was quickly consumed by the orb. From that day on, he completely changed. It was because I was only focused on restoring this country that I committed such a horrendous mistake. Please, forgive me, Prince Marth...

speaker: Marth
text: I can't believe all that happened. ..... Where is Nyna now?

speaker: Boah
text: When Hardin discovered that she had taken the Fire Emblem, he had her confined in her room. After that, she would still communicate in secret with me. However, Hardin found out and then wounded me. He also handed Nyna over to Gharnef.

speaker: Marth
text: Gharnef...!?

speaker: Boah
text: Mmm... Gharnef had always wanted to take Nyna. He said that the resurrection of the dark dragon required the blood of noble clerics... And so... He took Nyna... To use her as a live sacrifice... Lord Marth, I'm already done for. I will give my Thoron and Physic to you. I beg of you, please rescue Nyna. Even if Archanea is destroyed it no longer matters... I only wish for Nyna to be safe...

speaker: Marth
text: Jagen, where in the world are we...?

speaker: Jagen
text: This is the path depicted in the Anri Saga. The first obstacle in Anri's Way: the Desert of Death. With its scorching sun, raging sandstorm, savage clansmen of the sands and wyverns that soar and dominate the skies. As the city of illusion shimmers in the distance, we can only stand and gaze... Or so the legend has it.

speaker: Marth
text: So Anri came through here as well. And by himself, too...

speaker: Jagen
text: That’s right. King Anri began his travels here, to obtain the divine sword, Falchion. And that was so that he could rescue Princess Artemis… Although it will be long, I would like to describe the legend of Anri. 100 years ago… The ruler of this continent, the Holy Kingdom of Archanea, was destroyed by the dragon tribe.Humans were enslaved and lived each day in despair. Some people wielded weapons to fight back, but they couldn’t defeat the dragon tribe, and many people died. Also, the humans’ only hope, the Archanean royal family, was wiped out, and so the world lost all hope. However, at that time, at a small city called Altea. It was discovered that the princess of Archanea was hiding there. The angered Dolhr Empire sent soldiers to Altea, aiming to capture the princess. That princess… Artemis was prepared to give up her own life to save the citizens. However the citizens of Altea swore that, even if they were completely annihilated, they would protect the princess. Knowing that the princess was still alive, the citizens of Pales gathered a liberation army, and continued the fight against the Dolhr Empire. The leader of the liberation army, Duke Cartas, fought with the royal shield, given to him by Artemis. As a result, he received enormous support. Thanks to his efforts, the war finally began to become in their favour. But then, the king of the Earth Dragons, Medeus, finally moved out. The dark breath of Earth Dragons possessed horrendous destructive power and had the effect of halving the enemy’s strength. Under such a dire situation it was thought that Altea’s resistance wasn’t going to hold out. Then, at that time, a Sage appeared and told the people that at the Ice Dragons’ Temple, to the distant north, was a sword blessed by the deities. With that sword, the Earth Dragons could be defeated, but it definitely wasn’t an easy task to reach the temple…

speaker: Marth
text: So Anri, to save his beloved Artemis, left on a journey to obtain the sword?

speaker: Jagen
text: Yes, that’s right. But I think that’s enough for today. We still have a long road ahead of us…

speaker: Tiki
text: Mar-Mar!! It's been aaages. It's me, Tiki! I've wanted to see you for so long.

speaker: Marth
text: Huh... Tiki?! You came to welcome us? Oh, I see... you've been living with Lord Gotoh, haven't you? But you've certainly grown since last time. I'm glad to see you're well.

speaker: Tiki
text: Yeah... But I was so lonely. 'Cause you never came to see me...

speaker: Marth
text: I'm sorry. But I could never forget about you. I had intended to invite you back to Altea once things had calmed down.

speaker: Tiki
text: Mar-Mar... I... I love you!

speaker: Xane
text: ...Gotcha!

speaker: Marth
text: Xa... Xane!!!

speaker: Xane
text: I’m really sorry. I couldn’t help it after seeing that serious expression on your face… Sorry, don’t be angry. I was ordered, by Gato, to wait here for you. While I was waiting I got more and more angry, wondering why I had to do something so boring. So I thought I’d think of a prank to pull on you. But, my Tiki impression was pretty good wasn’t it? Huh, what’s with the anxious face? Well, shall we get goin'? You wanted to see Lord Gotoh, right?

speaker: Marth
text: Xane, how do you know Lord Gotoh? Just who are you?

speaker: Xane
text: Well, lemme see. I don't think that really matters right now. Hey, put that jaw back in place and follow me.

speaker: Phina
text: Huff... huff... Please... help me... The thieves... They're going to...

speaker: Phina
text: No, it can't be! You're... one of them... as well? Oh, fine... Do your worst! If you're going to kill me, do it fast!!

speaker: Navarre
text: Girl... Get behind me. The Altean army is marching towards the south of this forest. I'll take you to them.

speaker: Phina
text: Huh? You're going to help me? You mean, you're not with the thieves?

speaker: Navarre
text: Until just now, I was. But, I've changed my mind.

speaker: Phina
text: Why...?

speaker: Navarre
text: There's someone in the Altean army that I want to see. That's all.

speaker: Phina
text: Hmmm... But really, it's 'cause I'm cute, right? At any rate, I'm glad. My name's Phina. I'm a dancer from Warren. People say that once they see my dancing, they feel instantly refreshed! I can show you, if you like. Oh, I should tell you my story: I got separated from my troupe, and wandered into this forest. And then, those horrible thieves came and tried to take me by force... But it's okay now. You seem kind of scary, but actually you're very kind. However, your appearance is... Your face isn't bad, but your dress sense is kind of lacking. And, ugh, what's with your hair? You know, nowadays...

speaker: Navarre
text: Just stop talking! Anyway, don't stray too far. We'll cut our way to the west corner, and then escape through there. If you want to live, then shut up and come with me.

speaker: Phina
text: Ah... Y-yes, sorry...

speaker: Villager
text: The ancient Fane of Raman is just a treasure trove to thieves. You can see 'em carrying the stolen treasure all over the place. I hope they get cursed or something...

speaker: Villager
text: The ones protecting the bridge are Astram's free company: powerful men who stop at nothing. As a wise man once said: "Let sleeping dogs lie", eh?

speaker: Villager
text: I wonder if you've seen that young lady's dance? Marvelous, isn't it? Makes a tired body feel healthy again in the blink of an eye!

speaker: Villager
text: You must never go near that cave. I heard a rumor that in that cave dwells a terrible fire dragon.

speaker: Astram
text: Traitors! I'll show you the might of the Mercurius!

speaker: Astram
text: Midia... My love...

speaker: Dahl
text: Tryin' to take a cut from a thief's plunderin'... You people ain't even human!

speaker: Dahl
text: Murderers... the lot of you...

speaker: Jagen
text: Sire, we've driven away the thieves, but the temple was completely ransacked; anything that wasn't nailed down is gone.

speaker: Marth
text: Really, even Raman Temple has been reduced to ruins? This is a frightful age we’re in.

speaker: Jagen
text: Yes, I'm sure even Guardian Deity Naga would be furious. 'Tis truly the end of civilzation.

speaker: Marth
text: Jagen, do you know the legend of Naga?

speaker: Jagen
text: Yes; only vaguely, however. It's said that a thousand years ago... when there was not one king in the lands, people lived in small villages. One day, terrible monsters descended and the humans were massacred, pushed to the brink of extinction. The few who survived prayed to the gods for salvation. The gods heard their prayers, and a gigantic warrior was sent down to earth. The warrior carried a gleaming blade of light in his right hand, and in his left hand, a shield embedded with five orbs. Then, after a fierce battle, he eradicated the monsters and returned to the heavens. He was our guardian deity, Naga, and this temple is dedicated to him. "He was the avatar of the gods: our guardian deity..." Your highness, you should know that line from the first chapter of the Raman Bible.

speaker: Marth
text: With the blade of light and the five orbs... That is the legend of Naga...

speaker: Jagen
text: Well then, sire. We have to cross the Chiasmir Bridge soon. We must hurry; if the enemy takes it, getting across will be nigh impossible.

speaker: Marth
text: Alright then, inform the whole army: We cross Chiasmir Bridge at once. Make sure no one falls behind!

speaker: Jagen
text: Your highness, we've entered the castle! But don't forget that Hardin is being protected by the Darksphere. To fight him , you must have the Lightsphere!! Be sure to let the person fighting him carry it.

speaker: Hardin
text: Midia, even you betrayed me. Archanea's paladins have lost their touch.

speaker: Midia
text: You fool!! Don't you see it? What you're doing isn't normal. Where did you take Nyna to? Bring her back to us now!!

speaker: Hardin
text: Nyna! That woman betrayed me. I just wanted to destroy Grust. And she had to go and give the Emblem to that boy... Those who betray me must die. Midia, you're no exception!!

speaker: Midia
text: If you want to take my life, go ahead. But Hardin... Do you know how much suffering you've caused because of your stupid jealousy? Just open your eyes and see!

speaker: Hardin
text: Stupid jealousy...? Haha... You can say what you like. This world is corrupt and full of annoying people. Is this kind of world even worth anything? It would be far better for it to be destroyed. Midia, you shall watch here... As Prince Marth dies by hand!!

speaker: Hardin
text: Marth...? As a servant of the Empire, you dared to invade Millennium Court. I am disappointed in you. So Altea's Prince of Light is just a lowlife.

speaker: Marth
text: Hardin! Your are being controlled by the Darksphere, and have lost your just heart!! Please, you must return to normal!

speaker: Hardin
text: Hahaha...! You are so naive, Marth. I attacked Altea solely because of my hatred of you. In the previous war, it was only because you were the descendant of Anri that Nyna gave the Emblem to you, and chose you to become the leader of the alliance. Prince of Light... What nonsense! If you hadn't received my support you would have died long ago, so don't act all big, Marth!! From that day on, I hated you. I kept silent for Nyna, but I knew I would have to deal with you eventually. This has nothing to do with the orb!

speaker: Marth
text: Hardin... Is that true... Your hatred of me... I didn't know...

speaker: Hardin
text: Ha... That's why you're just a boy. Marth! Come to me, so I can use my Gradivus to pierce your heart!! In this tiny continent, I am the only hero that is needed!

speaker: Hardin
text: Rebels... Did you come here to get yourselves killed? I'll show you to fear my Gradivus!!

speaker: Hardin
text: Marth... Your highness... I have finally awakened... From my deep dream... Your highness... I am deeply sorry... I fought with my inner demon. However I was too weak... I resisted with all my might... But I still lost... I hoped for your highness' hand to end my life... That way I could be saved... Your highness... Nyna... Please take care of Nyna... She... I hope you... can tell her... In the... end... I still... loved her... I hope... She can... forgive me...

speaker: Jagen
text: Marth, it's finally over. Now, the world is safe. Look, the princesses are over there...

speaker: Marth
text: Sister! And there's Princess Nyna... And Lena and Maria was well.

speaker: Nyna
text: Marth, you finally came. I am so happy...

speaker: Nyna
text: Gwaa!! Damn, you're carrying the Binding Shield... Urgh... My illusion has been shattered! Come, Dark Priests. It has come to this... We must resurrect the Shadow Dragon immediately!

speaker: Jagen
text: Huh, wasn't that Gharnef? He and his men pretended to be the princesses.

speaker: Marth
text: Mmm, but what are they planning? They said something about resurrecting the Shadow Dragon... So my sister was indeed taken by Gharnef...

speaker: Jagen
text: Your highness, I apologize for interrupting you, but Gotoh has come.

speaker: Marth
text: Huh, Gotoh!? Please call him here!!

speaker: Gotoh
text: Marth, you have done well. You have all five orbs in your possession. Because of your efforts the lost Binding Shield has finally been restored.

speaker: Marth
text: Yes! The five orbs have attached onto the royal shield... So this is the Binding Shield? But, Gotoh, what should I do next? After seeing Gharnef's expression, it seems he really has taken my sister and the others. I can't just leave them.

speaker: Gotoh
text: Mmm... I understand your feelings... But you must first restore the seal on the Earth Dragons. Those beasts will soon awaken from their slumber. When they appear from the ground they will burn everything, and create Hell on Earth. Go, Marth. Send the awakened Earth Dragons back into the darkness of the seal!!

speaker: Jagen
text: Marth, it's finally over. Now, the world is safe. Look, the princesses are over there...

speaker: Marth
text: Sister! And there's Princess Nyna... And Lena and Maria as well. It's great to see that everybody is safe.

speaker: Nyna
text: Marth, you finally came. I am so happy... I will need your help to restore Archanea.

speaker: Elice
text: You really worked hard, Marth. You are my pride.

speaker: Lena
text: Lord Marth, with our combined strength we have already vanquished Gharnef. Please relax.

speaker: Maria
text: The world is safe now. Your highness, please hurry back to Altea.

speaker: Marth
text: Really? It's good to see everybody well. But you all don't look too good...

speaker: Nyna
text: Everybody is tired from battling Gharnef. But it doesn't matter now, so please don't worry.

speaker: Marth
text: Really...? Nyna, I am sorry about Hardin. I couldn't save him.

speaker: Nyna
text: It's fine. He was devoured by his own ambitions, so it is not unexpected that he was lost. Well, Marth, you should hurry back to your homeland. Everybody is probably worried about you. With your remaining time, you must live well. As long as there are still people in this world, your name will never be forgotten.

speaker: Marth
text: Xane, we've already climbed this high. It's so cold... Even breathing is hard.

speaker: Xane
text: We're almost there. Look, can you see over there? That's the Ice Dragons' Temple where Gotoh is.

speaker: Marth
text: But, that was quite a shock. Tiki is actually the daughter of the Divine Dragon King. Also, both Gotoh and you are Divine Dragons.

speaker: Xane
text: Ah... When the Divine Dragons fought the Earth Dragons they over-exhausted their dragonstones, and so practically became extinct. Aside from Naga, only Gotoh, me and the just born Tiki survived. However, after the war we discarded our dragonstones, so we could no longer become dragons again. Even so, I still have knowledge and power that exceeds that of humans. Gotoh followed Naga's orders to protect humans, but that's got nothing to do with me. I don't like humans. They scorned the Manaketes, even though they had lost their power, and treated them like filth. I can fully understand why Medeus and the others hated humans so much. The Earth Dragon King, Medeus, tricked his own tribe and became a Manakete by himself. He used to follow Naga's orders and guarded the Dragons' Altar. However the once docile humans finally achieved power and became aggressive. They even started to attack the Manaketes that lived in peace. The Manaketes were angered by the betrayal of humans, and gathered at the Dolhr region. They formed their own kingdom of Manaketes and began a war to conquer the humans. To save the humans, Gotoh handed the Falchion to Anri and he created an academy of magic at Khadein. But whoever won wasn't any of my concern.

speaker: Marth
text: Then, why are you helping me? I'm also a human...

speaker: Xane
text: You're different from the others. You don't seem like an unreliable person either...

speaker: Marth
text: Mmm... Thank you, Xane.

speaker: Xane
text: Don't... don't be silly. I'll get embarrassed. Anyway, let's head to the temple, but be careful of the Ice Dragons. Although they're also wild dragons, they will instinctively try to protect their temple. Poor guys...

speaker: Marth
text: Hey, Xane. Gotoh didn't really mention anyting about the five orbs, but I thought they were very important. Do you know anything about them?

speaker: Xane
text: Gotoh was afraid of shocking you so he didn't say anything. I will tell you. However, after I've told you, you'll probably think it was better off not knowing. The orbs rest on the shield that seals the Earth Dragons... Basically they are part of the Shield of Seals. Since ancient times, the Divine Dragons have passed down these sacred jewels, each possessing different powers. To put it simply, the shield is just a pedastal and the five orbs are what creates the power of the seal. So if any one of the orbs is lost the seal will weaken.

speaker: Marth
text: Hmm, is that so? But, how come the orbs were scattered?

speaker: Xane
text: Because the shield was broken. The Shield of Seals was displayed at the Fane of Raman, and it was stolen by somebody who ended up breaking it...

speaker: Marth
text: When did that happen?

speaker: Xane
text: Around 600 years ago. To recover the shield, Gotoh spend many years searching the lands. In the end, he only found the five orbs, with the shield nowhere to be seen. Not only that, but the five orbs, which he painfully collected, were scattered again after Raman was attacked in the previous war.

speaker: Marth
text: Really? ...So that was why Gotoh was looking for the lost jewels... the orbs?

speaker: Xane
text: Yep, the Starsphere, Lightsphere and Geosphere... as well as the Darksphere and Lifesphere. The Lightsphere is in Gotoh's possession, that Starsphere was shattered and the Darksphere was given to Hardin by Gharnef.

speaker: Marth
text: The Geosphere is in Altea and all that remains is the Lifesphere.

speaker: Xane
text: Ah... Anyway, let's enter the temple. From now on I will also help you fight. Well, let's go!

speaker: Arlen
text: Merric. It's time to put an end to this.

speaker: Merric
text: Wait, Arlen! Why do we have to fight? We were both Master Wendell's pupils: we're friends, are we not? Why do you despise me so?

speaker: Arlen
text: I was Master Wendell's disciple before you, and I was the stronger one. Even so, Master Wendell gave you Excalibur. He should have given it to me! Clearly, I was the only one worthy to be his successor, yet he...

speaker: Merric
text: But I have no intention of succeeding Master Wendell. I hold no ill feelings for Khadein, but once I finish studying I plan to go home. Back in Altea, there is somebody I must protect for the rest of my life... So, Arlen, please! Why don't you join us so we can take back Altea?

speaker: Arlen
text: Altea, you say?! Why should we help a country that rebelled against the empire and attempted to invade their fair nation? The mage corps of Khadein have sworn allegiance to Emperor Hardin. Oh, I see... I knew it was you... YOU dragged the Altean army here!

speaker: Merric
text: No!! That's not how it is!

speaker: Arlen
text: Shut your mouth, traitor!! I won't listen to your lies any longer! Your Excalibur and my Thoron; we'll put them to the test!

speaker: Wendell
text: Arlen! What are you doing?!

speaker: Arlen
text: Master Wendell...

speaker: Wendell
text: You still don't understand my decision, do you? Indeed, as a mage, your power surpasses mine. But you lack compassion. That is why I did not grant you Excalibur.

speaker: Arlen
text: ... Compassion...?

speaker: Wendell
text: I had decided that you were to be my successor when the time came. To think you would harbor a grudge towards me... Does that not make you the same as Gharnef?

speaker: Arlen
text: The same as Gharnef...? Teacher! What are you saying?

speaker: Wendell
text: Arlen, listen to me... Gharnef, along with Pontifex Miloah, were Lord Gotoh's best pupils. But Lord Gotoh saw Gharnef's weakness, and so he left Khadein and the Aura tome to Pontifex Miloah. Gharnef, overcome by jealousy, stole the Darksphere from Lord Gotoh, and created the Imhullu tome. As a result... His heart was trapped within the Darksphere for all eternity. Wrath and envy led him to ruin. Do you understand now, Arlen...?

speaker: Arlen
text: ...Teacher... ...Teacher! I'm so sorry. I... I was wrong. Please... find it in your heart to forgive me!

speaker: Wendell
text: Arlen, you will use that power of yours for the good of the people. Understand?

speaker: Gotoh
text: Marth... Do you hear me?

speaker: Marth
text: Lord Gotoh! Yes, I can. You are speaking to me through magic, are you not? Lord Gotoh, I must ask: what has happened to cause Hardin to suddenly change so much?

speaker: Gotoh
text: Hmm... The Darksphere is the culprit... Hardin's soul is trapped within the Darksphere...

speaker: Marth
text: The Darksphere? What on earth is that?

speaker: Gotoh
text: Light, Star, Earth, Life and Darkness... In this world, there exist five sacred orbs. The Darksphere is that which complements the Lightsphere; in battle, it possesses the enemy's mind, negating their attacks. But the Darksphere also amplifies wrath and envy, and can turn their owner into a demon. Hardin must have obtained the Darksphere from somewhere... And now his heart has been lost to it.

speaker: Marth
text: But why? He should have been happy after his union with beloved Princess Nyna, so why the envy?

speaker: Gotoh
text: Prince... Humans are never simple creatures... In any case, the only object that can overcome Hardin's Darksphere is the Lightsphere. If you want to do something about him, then you had best come and get it from me.

speaker: Marth
text: Huh? Really, Lord Gotoh? If we have the Lightsphere, then we can save Hardin?

speaker: Gotoh
text: Well... If his heart is not completely consumed, then perhaps.

speaker: Marth
text: Lord Gotoh! Please, lend the Lightsphere to me.

speaker: Gotoh
text: If you come in person to the Ice Dragon's Temple where I reside, then you shall have it. But that will be no easy task. So, Marth. Do you have the courage to walk the path that Anri walked?

speaker: Marth
text: Yes, I do! I will go!! Please, allow me to go! I must have the Lightsphere!

speaker: Catria
text: Prince Marth!! Thank goodness you've come to Macedon!

speaker: Marth
text: Catria?! I received word that there was a rebellion in Macedon. Are you unharmed?

speaker: Catria
text: Yes, I'm fine. My older sister Palla and I managed to escape somehow. But Princess Minerva was captured by the rebels. Prince Marth, please... You have to rescue Princess Minerva! At this rate, her life will be in danger!

speaker: Marth
text: Of course I will help her. Catria, please take us to where she is.

speaker: Catria
text: Yes, my lord! But first we have to break through these woods. General Rumel's dragon knight squad is lurking within this area. If we approach from the front, we'll be easy pickings for them.

speaker: Marth
text: I see...So you're suggesting we flank them from the left or right. Thank you, Catria. Leave it to us!

speaker: Villager
text: Warren's a bit of an idiot. Just 'cause they paid him well, he went ahead and joined the rebel army! Ahh, to think a fool like him was once acquainted with the fair Catria...

speaker: Villager
text: Look out for those pilfering thieves. If they take off with your precious treasure, you won't ever get it back. Never let them escape from your sight.

speaker: Villager
text: Because of the last war, every nation has been forced to lead hard lives. The only well-off country is Archanea, ruled by Emperor Hardin.

speaker: Villager
text: Some dirty thieves took our village treasure, the Lady Sword, and ran off with it. Only women can wield the incredible power of that sword. Please, prise it back from their filthy hands.

speaker: Villager
text: Beware when dracoknights are around. Even from a far-off distance, they can move all at once and swoop down on you!

speaker: Catria
text: Warren?! Even a good man like you has sided with the rebel army...

speaker: Warren
text: Catria the White, huh? It's been a while. You know I'm just a common hunter. If they pay me enough, I'll do anything.

speaker: Catria
text: Warren, listen to me! Princess Minerva endeavored to create a country where its people could live at ease. She exiled soldiers and generals of ill repute to accomplish that goal. But General Rucke, despite knowing this, roused the soldiers into a coup d'etat. Can't you see? He's just trying to make this country into his own! And you can honestly say you're okay with that?

speaker: Warren
text: ...I see. Well, I don't like the military acting as if they owned the place... Alright then. If you're going to help the princess, then so will I.

speaker: Warren
text: No hard feelings. I don't have anything against you, but this is the way I live. Forgive me!

speaker: Warren
text: Damn it... I should've seen this coming...

speaker: Rumel
text: Taste the terror of Macedon's fearless dracoknight squad!

speaker: Rumel
text: General Rucke, I leave the rest to you...

speaker: Jagen
text: Sire, we found someone most unusual confined in one of the fortress rooms.

speaker: Marth
text: Hm? ...Linde! How did you wind up in a dangerous place like this?

speaker: Kris
text: Sire, do you know this woman?

speaker: Marth
text: Yes, this is Linde. Her natural talent for magic helped us a great deal in the last war.

speaker: Linde
text: Prince Marth! Thank heavens. What a pleasant surprise meeting you here. I desperately needed to see you again, so I set out to find you. But the Macedonian soldiers found me suspicious and they dragged me to this fortress...

speaker: Marth
text: Is that so? I'm glad you're safe. But, why were you looking for me? Shouldn't you be by Princess Nyna's side?

speaker: Linde
text: I was requested by Princess Nyna to deliver you this.

speaker: Marth
text: Huh? This...! This is the Fire Emblem! The royal heirlom of Archanea: the Emblem Shield!

speaker: Kris
text: The Fire Emblem... I heard that in the last war, Princess Nyna entrusted you with it, sire...

speaker: Marth
text: Indeed. I looked after this as Archanea's representative in the last war. But why give this to me now? Especially at a time when Archanea has so much influence under Emperor Hardin's reign? In this peaceful age, why is Princess Nyna giving me the "Champion's Proof"...?

speaker: Linde
text: I don't understand either. Princess Nyna didn't explain why, just that I had to give it to you... I remember her eyes seemed so sad... I think she may have been crying...

speaker: Marth
text: Princess Nyna crying?! What on earth has been happening...? Linde, after this battle ends, I will go see Princess Nyna. Until then, I want you to remain with us.

speaker: Linde
text: Yes, Prince Marth!!

speaker: Michalis
text: Minerva, if you wait in this village, you will most certainly run into Marth. I don't like him, but he is indeed noble. Join forces with him.

speaker: Minerva
text: Brother, what are you going to do now? Won't you come with me...?

speaker: Michalis
text: I have no intention of doing that. I only wish to find Maria and bring her home to Macedon.

speaker: Minerva
text: You've changed, Brother... Or should I say, you've returned to how you used to be. As I thought, back then you were being controlled by Gharnef's dark magic.

speaker: Michalis
text: No, no magic could bend my will. I wished to crush the arrogant Archanea, and establish Macedonian supremacy over this continent. But Father, without bending his ear to me, distanced himself from me and later had me banished.

speaker: Minerva
text: Are you saying that's why you murdered Father? What a fool you were... Didn't you realize that was Gharnef's plotting all along? Yes, Father was strict with you. But it was only because he loved you. Why couldn't you see that?

speaker: Michalis
text: Enough, Minerva. Do you take me for a fool? After I was defeated, I wandered the gap between life and death. When I had come to, in front of me, I was Maria--her eyes full of tears--praying to the gods. While I treated her like a pawn, Maria, she shed tears for me... Minerva, I'm going now. I have to save Maria. At least that can be my atonement!

speaker: Minerva
text: Michalis...

speaker: Marth
text: Jagen, everybody appears to be safe. That’s great to see.

speaker: Jagen
text: But, your highness, what should we do next?

speaker: Marth
text: Hmm... I want to go home to Altea, but if we can't prevail against Hardin, then we can't go back. What in the world are we supposed to do...?

speaker: Jagen
text: Please wait a second. I just received some news.

speaker: Jagen
text: Sire, it's an emergency! I have just come into some new information. The Khadein mage corps has launched an offensive against us. It seems Khadein has allied with the Empire.

speaker: Marth
text: What!? Even Khadein means to be our enemy... Merric, what are you...

speaker: Jagen
text: At this rate, it seems we have no choice. Sire, we need to break into the sanctuary, but you must be prepared to make sacrifices. If we don't hurry, Archanea's pursuit force will reach our rear and we'll be trapped.

speaker: Marth
text: I understand. We've no choice. Everyone, let's break into the sanctuary! But avoid needless fights if possible!

speaker: Villager
text: A swordslayer will demonstrate your might against a mercenary or a hero. You should definitely get one if you can.

speaker: Villager
text: From here on north, you won't see no more shops. If you're going that way, you should stock up now.

speaker: Villager
text: The person commanding Khadein's mage corps is a young man named Arlen. He's not a bad man, but he can be a bit uncooperative. Seems he regards his old rival, Merric, with disdain. Hmm... I reckon only Lord Wendell could talk some sense into him.

speaker: Marth
text: Huh? Princess Minerva, why are you here?

speaker: Minerva
text: My brother... Michalis, he helped me.

speaker: Marth
text: Really? That's good to hear. I was so worried once I heard that Prince Michalis had taken you. But, for him to rescue you: what in the world happened?

speaker: Minerva
text: Maria saved Michalis's life. She's kind, unlike myself... Maria's kindness was able to touch the heart of even a man like Michalis.

speaker: Marth
text: But, isn't that what you wanted? That's why you deliberately avoided killing Michalis. Am I wrong, Princess?

speaker: Marth
text: I can understand. No one can sever the ties between family so easily. Princess, please lift your spirits. I would like you to fight with us again, just like before. I would like Macedon's strength and yours in order to put a stop to Hardin's designs.

speaker: Yodel
text: I will not forgive intruders upon our holy sanctuary! Earth, show your fury! Bolganone!!

speaker: Yodel
text: Arlen... Was this really what you wanted...?

speaker: Jagen
text: The atmosphere inside the building seems somewhat strange.

speaker: Marth
text: Indeed, something seems to be happening. Let's go, Jagen. I'm worried about Merric!

speaker: Toras
text: Commander Lang. The... A-Altean army has arrived...

speaker: Lang
text: You moron. Why are you so panicked? With their nation and name in ruins, the Alteans are of no consequence to us.

speaker: Toras
text: But, Sir Jeorge's archers left to quell the rebellion. Can we win with just our troops?

speaker: Lang
text: Why didn't you tell me earlier? Call Jeorge back to the castle this instant! While you're there, find that hired sword, Navarre, and bring him here. General Toras! I'm heading inside. You will defend this location till your last breath. Do NOT let the enemy get close. Do I make myself clear?!

speaker: Soldier
text: Captain Jeorge. We've received orders to return to the castle immediately.

speaker: Jeorge
text: Orders from Lang, huh? I'm not fond of that man. His treatment of our people is simply intolerable. To work beneath him is an insult. Pay his orders no mind.

speaker: Soldier
text: But, Captain! You'll be accused of treason! Captain?! You can't be planning to defect to Altea...

speaker: Jeorge
text: No, that's not an option. If I were to defect now, I'd drag the entire platoon down with me. So for that reason alone, I will absolutely not take any risks that might besmirch our name.

speaker: Soldier
text: Captain Jeorge...

speaker: Jeorge
text: Anyway, inform everyone: Do not move from your stations. However, if the enemy approaches, you may engage them.

speaker: Villager
text: Y'know, lately I haven't seen that mercenary, Samuel. I thought that he might have joined your ranks, but I guess not... He's as lax as they get, but you can't go wrong with his skill.

speaker: Villager
text: Oh, Alteans, hear our plea! Please, defeat General Lang! As long as that man lives, peace is but a fleeting dream.

speaker: Elder
text: Ohh, if isn't Prince Marth! I wonder how my granddaughter Lena is faring, hm? What, you don't know? I see... Th-then... Do you still want this Hammerne staff? At least, if Lena's pupil Marisha were around, I'm sure she could use it... Well, whatever be the case, I've no use for a souvenir. Please, make good use of it.

speaker: Julian
text: Hey, Rickard! I see you haven't tired of stealin'.

speaker: Rickard
text: Ah! Chief! How nice to see ya. Well, I was plannin' on workin' with you and makin' loadsa money, but you had to go and quit the business! Fallin' head over heels for that beautiful cleric, and then dumpin' me... That's just too cruel! Did our love really mean that little to you?

speaker: Julian
text: Can it, you little fink!! People'll get the wrong idea about us, if you keep talkin' like that. Anyway, forget about thievin' and come with me to fight for justice.

speaker: Rickard
text: Hmm... alright then! I'll follow you anywhere. I do adore ya, Chief!

speaker: Jeorge
text: You wouldn't have needed to die if you hadn't come so close...

speaker: Jeorge
text: Fools...

speaker: Rickard
text: Chief, where aaare ya?

speaker: Rickard
text: Tch. Man, I messed up big time.

speaker: Toras
text: Projection 44.5 degrees! Fiiiire!!!

speaker: Toras
text: General Lang... Altea is too strong...

speaker: Jagen
text: Sire, we've finally seized control of Grust. However, a number of enemies are concealed within the castle. Our job here is far from over.

speaker: Marth
text: Yes, I know. Lang must be stopped here and now. Or else we forsake the people of Grust.

speaker: Jagen
text: That’s right. He must be defeated at all costs… But we don’t know what dastardly plans he has prepared for us. We must take extra caution when fighting inside the castle!

speaker: Marth
text: This is the Ice Dragons' Temple. Anri's final destination...

speaker: Jagen
text: Yes. It was here that Anri obtained the Falchion, which he used to defeat Medeus with. Then, encouraged by the citizens of Altea, he became their first king.

speaker: Marth
text: But, in the end he wasn't able to be with Artemis... Why? Weren't they loving together?

speaker: Jagen
text: The nobles of Archanea didn't want Anri, a former peasant, to become their own king. Instead they encouraged the princess to marry the leader of the liberation army, Duke Caldas. Princess Artemis was unable to refuse. "The bearer of the Fire Emblem, must give their life to the royal family". That is a saying passed down unflinchingly by the Archanea royal family. The Princess didn't tell Anri anything and accepted Caldas's engagement.

speaker: Marth
text: How could she...? That was unfair to Anri.

speaker: Jagen
text: What was worse was that the princess died immediately after giving birth to her newborn prince. Also King Anri never married in his life. The Kingdom of Altea was succeeded by his younger brother, King Marcelus... That is to say, your highness's great grandfather.

speaker: Marth
text: Such a tragic tale... So that was Artemis's fate? All because of the curse of the Fire Emblem...?

speaker: Gotoh
text: Marth, you must stand in front of this wall! Only then will the door open.

speaker: Gotoh
text: Prince Marth, you finally came! I should have expected nothing less from the one who possesses the heroic bloodline of Anri. To reward your courage, I will hand the Lightsphere to you. With this, the Darksphere will lose its power and it will no longer be impossible to fight Hardin. Also, about the Starsphere shards...

speaker: Gotoh
text: What!? You found all the shards? Thank you, then the Starsphere can be restored. Please wait a moment...

speaker: Gotoh
text: Marth, this is the Starsphere. You can take this with you as well.

speaker: Marth
text: Huh? Gotoh, why are you giving such an important item to me?

speaker: Gotoh
text: The only person that can restore the Shield of Seals is you... The Shield, itself, has chosen you.

speaker: Gotoh
text: You still don't understand? The Emblem shield you're carrying is the stolen Shield of Seals. To be honest, it was only recently that I noticed; its exterior had completely changed... After stealing it from the Fane of Raman, the thief removed its jewels and sold them off as treasures. The money was used to fund an army, which, along with three stolen weapons, was used to conquer the world. The thief that went on to become the king of Archanea had the shield, which brought him such good fortune, it became the emblem of his royal family. Now do you understand, Marth? It is what you are carrying, Archanea's Fire Emblem.

speaker: Marth
text: !! What... ...The first king of Archanea was originally a thief!? Is that true...? In that case, I can kind of understand the curse of the Fire Emblem... Then, Gotoh... If I can collect all five orbs, can I restore the Shield of Seals?

speaker: Gotoh
