text: Mmm... But please hurry up. The shield has already been broken for 600 years... It is almost time for the Earth Dragons, sealed underneath Macedon, to awaken from their slumber. Those evil Earth Dragons number several hundreds... No, several thousands. Once they awaken there will be nothing that we can do... I will leave Tiki in your care. You can find her in the room to the right. That Divine Dragon child should be able to help you battle the Earth Dragons. But, I will state clearly, if the Shield of Seals is not restored, Tiki will be destroyed.

speaker: Marth
text: Huh...!? Why is that...

speaker: Gotoh
text: That child is still developing. Without the Shield of Seals she will begin to degenerate. Eventually she will become wild and attack humans. I made her sleep, because I felt sad for her. But, if the Shield of Seals is restored I will no longer have to worry, because the shield will protect Tiki. Marth, please take care of Tiki. You must rescue that child from the path of ruin.

speaker: Gotoh
text: Is that so. You couldn’t find them all... There’s nothing you can do about it... Please hand your collected shards to me. Tiki is sleeping in the room to the right. But since the shield isn’t restored, I can’t let you see her. That child is still developing. Without the Shield of Seals she will begin to degenerate. Eventually she will become wild and attack humans. I cannot allow Tiki to awaken again. It is for her own good... Marth, once you’ve obtained all the treasures, head to the room to the left. I will be waiting for you...

speaker: Marth
text: Tiki!? Are you alright...

speaker: Tiki
text: Uh...

speaker: Marth
text: Tiki, it's me, Marth. Hey, open your eyes!

speaker: Tiki
text: ...Marth... .....! Oh Marth!! You came! You came to see Tiki!!

speaker: Marth
text: Yes, I hadn't seen Tiki in a long time. Are you feeling well?

speaker: Tiki
text: Uh... No. The bishop told me that I had to sleep again. But I don't want to... Because when I sleep I'm always alone. During my sleep, I dreamt many nightmares. There, I became a wild dragon, like those poor Fire Dragons and Ice Dragons. I attacked humans, and I killed them. No... No... When I awoke I was all alone in the dark room... I felt so strange, but also very scared... So very scared... But I couldn't leave that room. I cried many times, and then Uncle Bantu would come to comfort me as usual. One day he took me away, and took me to a human village. Living in that village was very fun, and everybody treated me well... In the short time, until I was discovered by Gharnef, I felt really happy. I don't want to sleep anymore... I feel that if I close my eyes once more, I will be unable to open them ever again. I don't want that. I want to live with everyone, I don't want to sleep again!

speaker: Marth
text: Tiki, it's alright now. I will protect you, so don't cry...

speaker: Tiki
text: Really...? I won't need to see those scary dreams again!?

speaker: Marth
text: That's right! Once the shield is restored, Tiki can live together with the rest of us. Don't worry, believe in me!

speaker: Tiki
text: Ah! I'm so happy!! Thank you, Marth!

speaker: Gotoh
text: Is that so...? So Tiki was that happy? It must have been hard for her, living like that. Although it was to protect that child, I did many bad things. She must hate me... Marth, you may leave. I will use my magic to send you to Altea instantly.

speaker: Marth
text: Gotoh, aren't you coming along with us?

speaker: Gotoh
text: Oh... I have something to investigate right now. You see, Gharnef has already began to act.

speaker: Marth
text: Gharnef...!? But isn't he dead?

speaker: Gotoh
text: Yes, his body was destroyed, but his vile spirit lives on in the Darksphere. He has also awakened the evil priests that served him, and they appear to be planning something terrible.

speaker: Marth
text: Really...? I see, Gotoh. Well, we'll move out then.

speaker: Gotoh
text: Mmm... Once I find anything, I will contact you immediately. Good luck, Marth. verything is in your hands. Please rescue dragons and humans from the path to ruin.

speaker: Gotoh
text: Marth, you may leave. I will use my magic to send you to Altea instantly.

speaker: Marth
text: Gotoh, aren’t you coming along with us?

speaker: Gotoh
text: Oh… I have something to investigate right now. You see, Gharnef has already began to act.

speaker: Marth
text: Gharnef…!? But isn’t he dead?

speaker: Gotoh
text: Yes, his body was destroyed, but his vile spirit lives on in the Dark Orb. He has also awakened the evil priests that served him, and they appear to be planning something terrible.

speaker: Marth
text: Really…? I see, Gotoh. Well, we’ll move out then.

speaker: Gotoh
text: Mmm… Once I find anything, I will contact you immediately. Good luck, Marth. Everything is in your hands. Please rescue dragons and humans from the path to ruin.

speaker: Marth
text: Jagen, where is this? Is this Macedon, or Dolhr?

speaker: Jagen
text: We're right at the countries' border. This is where Macedon's wyverns are born. However, these lands are ruled by savage barbarians. Even Macedon's soldiers are afraid to enter here.

speaker: Marth
text: So this is the Wyvern's Dale... Anyway, Jagen, we need to hurry. I feel like something is going to happen to my sister and the others. I have a bad feeling.

speaker: Young Man
text: On the other side of the mountains is a small hill, called the Dragon's Table. Recently, there have been eerie roaring sounds coming from there. Grandfather and the others are afraid a demon is about to awaken. You mustn't get to close to that place.

speaker: Man
text: This is the Wyvern's Dale. Don't go any further. Otherwise I fear you'll be burnt to death by the wyverns.

speaker: Marth
text: Prince Michalis!? What are you doing here? And you've suffered a grave wound. What happened?

speaker: Michalis
text: ...Marth... ...I have been waiting... for you...

speaker: Marth
text: Huh!?

speaker: Michalis
text: ...Take this...

speaker: Marth
text: ...! This is the Starlight tome. You're giving it to me!?

speaker: Michalis
text: That's right... Gharnef... Only with this spell can he be harmed. I managed to take it back from his possession...

speaker: Marth
text: Gharnef!? Where is he now?

speaker: Michalis
text: The Dragon's Table... Ha... I was careless... I could be... Defeated by Gharnef... Marth... Good luck... I'm already finished. If Minerva is still around... Tell her to... In my place... Rescue Maria...

speaker: Marth
text: Michalis!

speaker: Michalis
text: Your highness... I leave Maria's fate to you... Urgh.

speaker: Marth
text: So this is the Dragon's Table, where the Divine Dragon Naga sealed away the Earth Dragons... But, wasn't Medeus the guardian of the atlar...?

speaker: Gotoh
text: Medeus could not tolerate the humans' actions against the Manaketes. So he gathered the other dragon tribes and formed the Dolhr Empire, to destroy mankind. First he was defeated by Anri and second by you. But, Earth Dragons can't be destroyed easily due to their powerful life force... Medeus is now sleeping in the altar.

speaker: Marth
text: He's going to resurrect again!?

speaker: Gotoh
text: No, even an Earth Dragon shouldn't wake within a hundred years. Medeus is now changing his form. When he next awakens, he will become a fearful Shadow Dragon... No... Could it be... So that's why... Why Gharnef...

speaker: Marth
text: Huh, what is it Gotoh!?

speaker: Gotoh
text: Prince Marth, I finally understand why the clerics have been taken. Gharnef plans to use them to resurrect Medeus. To awaken a dragon requires the life force of females with pure and noble blood. Gharnef knew about this, so he went to capture the clerics. Mmm... Marth, we must hurry. The clerics are in grave danger. Medeus... He is going to resurrect once again!!

speaker: Lang
text: Heh heh heh... So the Alteans have come. Reinforcements are arriving soon; if we can hold out a little longer, we can make a pincer attack. Swordsman Navarre. When they open that door, you make your move. There is no need for restraint; slice them to pieces!

speaker: Navarre
text: Yeah... sure. Though the knights of Altea are hardly worthy enemies.

speaker: Lang
text: Oh-ho! That's my Navarre. They say not even Ogma of Talys is your equal.

speaker: Navarre
text: What? Ogma?! N... Naturally... A guy like him is no match for me.

speaker: Lang
text: I see. Glad to hear it. Then I'll leave this place in your capable hands, Navarre!

speaker: Caeda
text: Navarre, please hear me out! Lend your sword to our case, just once more!

speaker: Navarre
text: What? Who are you? I'll have no business with women or children... But, there's a first for everything... (Whoa, she's smoking!) What business do you have with me?

speaker: Caeda
text: ...... Y-you're not Navarre! Who are you?

speaker: Samuel
text: Yikes, I've been exposed, huh? I'm actually a stingy mercenary known as Samuel. Somehow, I keep getting mistaken for this famous "Navarre" swordsman guy. I got tired of it after a while, so I decided to pose as him and got myself hired. But I don't like this General Lang guy either. If you're alright with it, I'll lend you my sword.

speaker: Caeda
text: Yes... You'll do just fine...

speaker: Ogma
text: Navarre... You bastard...

speaker: Navarre
text: Stay away... This evening, my killing edge hungers for blood...

speaker: Ogma
text: Do you mean to kill me, no matter what? Hmph, very well. I knew that we'd have to settle our score eventually.

speaker: Samuel
text: Wait... Stay your blade! ...I'm no Navarre, I'm just a sham. I... it's me, Samuel. Have you forgotten, Ogma?

speaker: Ogma
text: Samuel?! Samuel, the gladiator from Knorda?

speaker: Samuel
text: Yes, I was a slave gladiator at the time, and you really helped me out. Even when everyone was making their escape, you stayed behind to distract the guards and ended up caught...

speaker: Samuel
text: I heard everything from my friends. How you were dragged out to the square and whipped until you looked like a corpse. How, by chance, the young Princess Talys, tears in her eyes, stood up for you and saved you. And that's why you swore your blade to Talys. Or rather... to the princess...

speaker: Ogma
text: Enough... Say no more! No more. It's in the past now... No more...

speaker: Samuel
text: ...Ogma... Anyway, I want to repay you! I'm following you from now on, okay?

speaker: Navarre
text: I pity your soul. But I can at least grant you a quick death. Take this! My killing edge!!

speaker: Samuel
text: Doh, I shouldn't have said that I was Navarre...

speaker: Lang
text: W-wait, please! I'm sorry... Please forgive me... I've only done as the Emperor ordered me to. I didn't agree with him, but I had no choice. So... so please, s-spare my life... I'll do anything you say. Yes... Just like this... Mwahaha! You shouldn't have let your guard down! You fool... Now die!

speaker: Lang
text: Urgh... Impossible... I have been defeated...

speaker: Marth
text: Lord Wendell! Thank goodness you're unharmed.

speaker: Wendell
text: Lang accused me of collaborating with the rebels and had me imprisoned. Even though I told him that I must fulfill a mission assigned to me by Archsage Gotoh...

speaker: Marth
text: A mission from Lord Gotoh?

speaker: Wendell
text: That's correct... You have seen the "Starsphere"--the holy orb with the twelve constellations etched on its surface. In order to pierce Gharnef's shadowy veil, Lord Gotoh created a sacred spell named "Starlight" from that orb.

speaker: Wendell
text: Unfortunately, the strain on the Starsphere was so severe that it shattered into twelve shards, which scattered into the sky. Lord Gotoh told me that this world has long been guarded by five orbs of mysterious arcane power, and that if even one of them is lost, the world will fall into irreparable ruin. By any means possible, we must gather the twelve star shards and restore the Starsphere.

speaker: Marth
text: Is... Is this a joke? That the world could just end... This is all very hard to take in. But aren't these the star shards? If so, we already have a few. After we retake Altea, we'd be glad to help you find the remaining shards and orbs.

speaker: Wendell
text: Of course... Your country was only just invaded by the Empire... I understand, Prince... I too shall fight to restore Altea, then. Thinking about it, my meeting with you is like a sign from Lord Gotoh himself. In that case, I shall surrender myself to fate. But, please, let's stop by the Fane of Raman. We may be able to find some star shards in the ancient temple.

speaker: Marth
text: Understood. If it's the Fane of Raman, we can go there on our way to Altea!

speaker: Marth
text: Jagen, we’ve finally arrived. Is that the rebels’ fortress?

speaker: Jagen
text: I just saw the occupation army’s commander, General Lang. You should ask him directly.

speaker: Lang
text: So you are Lord Marth. Currently the situation is relaxed. We have already subdued most of the rebels. All that remains is this fortress. Since you are here, I will leave the job of defeating the rebels’ leader, General Lorenz, to you.

speaker: Marth
text: What?! General Lorenz leads the rebels?! What would possess him to rebel of all things?!

speaker: Lang
text: Who knows? I haven't the foggiest idea, and frankly I don't care. Prince. You are to kill General Lorenz, and reclaim the children of the Grustian royal family that he's hiding. While you do that... We will slaughter the families of those who participated in this rebellion and raze their homes to the ground.

speaker: Marth
text: Are you insane?! They're innocent civilians!

speaker: Lang
text: I-insane!? Young man, are you questioning my orders?! Perhaps Altea, too, plans to rebel against Archanea...?

speaker: Marth
text: Of course not! That's not...

speaker: Lang
text: Prince Marth, your tiny country means absolutely nothing to me. Your rude behaviour is merely an irritation. Do not forget that I have the power of the empire behind me: I can crush weak, pesky insects like you any time I wish.

speaker: Marth
text: …Jagen, what’s going on? Why has Hardin handed over this country to such a man…?

speaker: Jagen
text: General Lang was once a noble of Archanea. However, in the previous war, he supported the Dolhrian Empire. I heard that he stole from other people, to add to his own wealth. I fear he has continued his ways at Grust, and caused suffering to its people. So General Lorenz’s rebellion is completely understandable.

speaker: Marth
text: Jagen! How can you say things so casually? If we don’t inform Hardin of the truth, more innocent people will be killed.

speaker: Jagen
text: Your highness, I understand your feelings. However, Lorenz’s rebellion is a fact. First, we must see how we can help him. Basically we should listen to what the citizens have to say, so we can affirm what has happened to this country. Then your highness can talk to General Lorenz personally.

speaker: Marth
text: But the rebels don’t know that we’re from Altea. Can we reach the fortress safely?

speaker: Jagen
text: Don’t worry. Most of the rebels have already fled. All that remains is Lorenz, and the children in the fortress. Blocking our path are only bandits, who have taken advantage of the confusion to raid villages. They are no problem for us. You can order Alen to defeat them in one blow if you want. However, your highness, we have some fresh recruits in our army that could use some fighting experience. To them, bandits are relatively strong foes. So be careful not to push them too much. If possible, I would have liked to fight as well, but my body is not what it used to be. I will stay by your highness’s side, as your tactician. Well, your highness, we should go!

speaker: Villager
text: After the last war, Princess Nyna let this country keep its sovereignty under the rule of General Lorenz. However, as soon as Hardin became emperor, General Lorenz was banished and Lang's troops came crawling in. Lang stole everything from us. He stole our gold, of course, but he even stole our food and our loved ones... Ah... If only General Camus were here! Then we wouldn't have to live in fear of people like Lang!

speaker: Villager
text: There aren't any young girls left in this country. They were all taken away by the imperial troops. They say General Lang keeps the really pretty ones to himself. What a dark, insane chapter in Grust's history...

speaker: Villager
text: The late King Grust had two children. Princess Yuliya and Prince Jubelo. They're still young. Maybe thirteen, or fourteen; cute little twins, both of them. In the last war, Gharnef, the Dark Pontifex, kidnapped the twins to blackmail the king. They were taken to Khadein, the city of magic, and locked away in a pitch-black room. At great personal risk, Pontifex Wendell saved them. He took them to a monastery to protect them.

speaker: Villager
text: General Lorenz took the royal children from Lord Wendell and raised them in Grust. The empire demanded their extradition, but Lorenz was afraid they would be killed, and hid them. The empire branded Lorenz a traitor, and sent General Lang here. Lang did horrible things to find the royal children. That's why we rose up. But, we lost. And now Lang is going to kill everyone in this entire country!

speaker: Villager
text: I heard that General Lorenz lived in Talys when he was young. Talys wasn't unified at the time, so there were a number of noble houses contending for control. Lorenz lent his power to the young patriarch of one house, and together they unified Talys into one country. Lorenz and that patriarch--now the king of Talys--remain close friends to this day.

speaker: Villager
text: I only saw him briefly, but that knight, Arran, looked awfully pale. You know, he's probably hit the wall, so to speak. I doubt he'll get any stronger, no matter how much he fights...

speaker: Villager
text: Oh... Please, show mercy to just this child. She's only ten years old.

speaker: Marth
text: Ma'am, please calm yourself. I am not here to take any children.

speaker: Villager
text: What... You're not imperial soldiers?

speaker: Marth
text: No... We're not. We didn't come to fight. If there's anything you need, please ask. It's not much, but we can give you food.

speaker: Marisha
text: Wait... Please, take me with you...

speaker: Marth
text: Huh...? You're... Are you really ten?

speaker: Marisha
text: No... I'm a grown woman, but Granny lied so that I wouldn't be taken away by the soldiers. Lang's soldiers are all monstrous. But you're different. You have very sweet eyes. Please, take me with you. I want you to take me away from this country, and take me to yours.

speaker: Villager
text: It's not safe for her to stay here. Please take her with you, and protect her. You can marry her, too, if you like. Marisha is a beautiful, good-natured lady, just like me! I'm sure she'll make a fine wife.

speaker: Marisha
text: No-no-no! Granny, it's far too early for that! Now you've made Marisha all flustered!

speaker: Bandit
text: Oh? A battle, is it? We're in luck, boys! Let's loot 'em villages before 'ey realize what's hit 'em!

speaker: Lorenz
text: Alright, that will do for now... Sir Ogma, please forgive me for getting you involved in this mess.

speaker: Ogma
text: I am here on King Talys's orders. As such, I will do everything in my power to help.

speaker: Lorenz
text: I see... Then I have a favor to ask of you. I want you to escort these children to Macedon. These children... Prince Jubelo and Princess Yuliya, are King Grust's orphans. Please. Take them safely to Lord Wendell in Macedon.

speaker: Ogma
text: Understood... I will guard these two with my life.

speaker: Lorenz
text: Thank you, Sir Ogma... Now, Prince Jubelo, Princess Yuliya, you will be leaving with Sir Ogma.

speaker: Yuliya
text: No! I'm not going! I won't leave you behind!

speaker: Lorenz
text: Princess... I cannot go. With this wound, I can barely even walk. It saddens me, but you two must go on without me.

speaker: Yuliya
text: You took that grievous wound to protect us... How can you tell us to just leave you behind now?! I will never leave. We will never leave your side, Lorenz!!

speaker: Ogma
text: What shall I do, General?

speaker: Lorenz
text: Hmm... this is most troublesome. Princess Yuliya is not one to change her mind easily... We will remain here.

speaker: Ogma
text: In that case, I will find some other way to help you. I will find Lang and bring him down... I will bury him with this sword, I swear on it. General Lorenz, you must hold out until then...!

speaker: Lorenz
text: Prince Marth! So it is you... How unfortunate, that I must fight... the Altean army and its prince...

speaker: Marth
text: Please, wait. I do not wish to fight with you. I heard about everything from the villagers. I've heard of all the atrocities Archanea has committed. I promise, I will inform Emperor Hardin of the truth and rescue Grust. So please, lower your weapons.

speaker: Lorenz
text: Prince... I am grateful for the offer. But, I am afraid that I cannot comply. Prince, you know nothing. Do you think that a man of Emperor Hardin's caliber would make a general out of a man as worthless as Lang without good reason? He called for an invasion: to crush the kingdom of Grust and make it a territory of the Empire.

speaker: Marth
text: No, it can't be! Hardin would never do something like that.

speaker: Lorenz
text: I know it's hard to believe. But I'm afraid that, ever since he became emperor, he has changed a great deal. He is no longer the Hardin you once knew. Prince, I have one final request of you. In this stronghold, I am protecting the young prince and princess of Grust. Please, find a way to help them. If you can do just that, I will have no regrets.

speaker: Marth
text: What... General Lorenz, what are you saying...?!

speaker: Lorenz
text: Prince Marth... My life in exchange for theirs... By any means necessary, please help them... This is the last thing I will ask.

speaker: Marth
text: General Lorenz!! ......This can't be happening......

speaker: Lorenz
text: What?! You're... the Altean army?! So even Altea has turned on us...

speaker: Lorenz
text: Forgive me, people of Grust...

speaker: Elder
text: Prince Marth... General Lorenz entrusted everything to you. You spared his life, and even heard him out. We, the people of Grust, thank you. Please, let me offer you a token of our gratitude. Here. We're protecting Prince Jubelo and Princess Yuliya in this stronghold. I beg you, do what you must to protect our last fragments of hope...

speaker: Marth
text: You, you're... Grust's royal heirs... Prince Jubelo and Princess Yuliya?!

speaker: Jubelo
text: Sniff... Lorenz... He's gone... How can we live on without him?

speaker: Yuliya
text: You monsters!! Stay away! You're going to murder us just like you murdered Lorenz!!

speaker: Marth
text: No, you have it all wrong!! We just...

speaker: Lang
text: Ah... Prince Marth. You finally caught these filthy traitors.

speaker: Marth
text: General Lang! Wait, please! These children have done nothing wrong. Allow me to take custody of them.

speaker: Lang
text: Don't make me laugh. These brats are coming with me to my castle. Besides, my dear prince, you have other, more important, priorities. I have received reports that there has been a military revolt in Macedon, and Princess Minerva has been imprisoned.

speaker: Marth
text: What...?! How could that happen to Macedon?! I understand my obligations, General Lang. Still, these children... Let them stay with me, please.

speaker: Lang
text: Prince, do not try my patience! Listen up you two! You're coming with me!

speaker: Yuliya
text: No, let me go!! Jubelo... help me!!

speaker: Jubelo
text: Yuliya... Yuliya...!!

speaker: Marth
text: Wait!! Lang! Release them at once!

speaker: Kris
text: Sire! Give me the order, and I'll get them safely back at once!

speaker: Jagen
text: Sire, don't do it!! You too, Kris! If we oppose Lang right here, right now, we run the risk of being branded traitors by Archanea.

speaker: Marth
text: But Jagen, are you telling me to simply allow Lang to take them?! I cannot stand for that...

speaker: Jagen
text: I understand how you feel, sire... But please remain patient for a little longer. If we head to Macedon... then rescue Princess Minerva, Macedon will surely lend us its strength.

speaker: Roshea
text: Wolf, Sedgar, Vyland. Is this really okay...? Can we really fight this battle?

speaker: Wolf
text: Roshea! What are you trying to say? Look, the Altean army is marching long the narrow mountain road. Now's our only chance to defeat them.

speaker: Vyland
text: Yes, Roshea. We swore that we could sacrifice our lives for Lord Hardin. Lord Hardin was the one who freed us plains people from slavery. If we don't fight Altea now, Millennium Court will fall. Do you want Lord Hardin to be defeated by them?

speaker: Sedgar
text: That's right! Prince Marth wants to destroy Archanea, and conquer the world. And that's why he joined forces with Macedon to crust Grust. Now he even has Gra under his rule. If we don't do something, the whole world will fall under his control.

speaker: Roshea
text: I still don't believe it. I cannot believe Prince Marth would have such ambitions.

speaker: Wolf
text: What? Are you saying that Emperor Hardin lied? Do you think that he would stoop to such a low!? Enough, Roshea!! You disappoint me, if you want to betray us then go ahead. Sedgar, Vyland, let's go. If we're too slow, they will pass us.

speaker: Roshea
text: Hey, wait! I won't betray you. I understand... I'll go.

speaker: King Aurelis
text: Oh, Prince Marth. It is good to see you.

speaker: Marth
text: Huh, aren't you King Aurelis?! What are you doing here?

speaker: King Aurelis
text: I came here to stop my country's army. Also I must apologise to your highness. I believed Hardin's words and followed Archanea, but I now realize my wrongs. Archanea's Empress Nyna secretly sent me a letter, saying that Hardin isn't normal and is ill... My country will remain neutral, and its knights will return to Aurelis. I hope you won't attack my men anymore.

speaker: Marth
text: I understand, your highness. I don't want to fight with you. Please forgive me for taking so many of your knights' lives.

speaker: King Aurelis
text: Oh! You really are like what the rumors say. My body is frail and I have no children, and even Hardin, my younger brother, has completely changed. Prince Marth, please protect Aurelis in my place. I will hand my whole country to you. I give this jewel to you as a gift. This is a magical jewel containing the divine power of life. I spent a lot of gold to buy it from a travelling merchant. I believe it will be useful to you. Don't worry about Hardin. Since he is a knight, it is natural for him to die in battle. That is his fate. Well, Prince Marth, I will go on ahead. I hop you will all be safe...

speaker: Roshea
text: I am Roshea of the Aurelis knights. I don't want to fight, but I can't betray my companions. Please forgive me...

speaker: Vyland
text: As long as we're here, we won't let you get to Millennium Court. If you don't want to die, run back to your country!

speaker: Sedgar
text: You... Why are you invading other countries? Have you been blinded by ambition?

speaker: Wolf
text: The leader of Aurelis' knights, Wolf, is here for your head!

speaker: Wolfguard
text: Lord Hardin...

speaker: Marth
text: Jagen, it seems we've finally crossed the peak. Millennium Court isn't far from here.

speaker: Jagen
text: Yes, if we go down from here, we will reach the capital of Millennium Court in an instant. Also, your highness, I just received news of an attempted coup in Millennium Court. The knights and civilians who opposed Hardin's actions rebelled against him. It seems their leader was Lady Midia.

speaker: Marth
text: What! Midia...? What happened?

speaker: Jagen
text: Unfortunately Lady Midia was defeated and was captured... Each day many people are executed. It is only a matter of time before Lady Midia shares the same fate.

speaker: Marth
text: Damn, Hardin... I can't believe that he would do that. Alright, let's go and rescue Midia! We must hurry to Millennium Court and end this once and for all. Jagen, let's go!!

speaker: Soldier
text: General, the missing Altean remnants have finally returned.

speaker: Eibel
text: Really? Haha...! What good timing. We will follow our original plan. Have Gra's soldiers move out to lure them and then defeat them in one go.

speaker: Soldier
text: Understood, but, what about "him"?

speaker: Eibel
text: The paladin, Abel? It doesn't matter if he betrays me! If he does, you will kill the female hostage!! He has already retired from the army. He won't swear loyalty to the prince again. Ha ha...! How will they avoid fighting Abel...? This will be very interesting to watch...

speaker: Old Man
text: In the forts are many enemies. Don't be careless.

speaker: Woman
text: Oh, you... Where did you all go to? You all went missing for so long that everyone became very worried about you.

speaker: Young Man
text: The Kingdom of Gra views Altea as its enemy. But, in reality, they were forced to fight because of their alliance with Archanea.

speaker: Woman
text: After Altea fell, Elice was taken to an unknown place by a black-robed bishop... Oh... Princess Elice... I pray that you are safe and well...

speaker: Young Woman
text: Since being ruled by the imperial army, our days have been difficultly passed. But, we all believed that Lord Marth would definitely come back for us. He would rescue us all from our suffering... Because, our Lord Marth is the warrior of light chosen by the deities... the Starlord!

speaker: Young Man
text: Nearby are enemy spies. Be careful! They will come from the forts.

speaker: Young Man
text: The mercenaries protecting the castle are Altea's elites. It would be great if they could become your allies.

speaker: Man
text: Oh, your highness, you've finally come. I have been waiting, to give this to you. However this village and the neighboring village...

speaker: Marth
text: Mmm, I understand. But, for the sake of everyone, you should start to make up with them...

speaker: Abel
text: Your highness... Please forgive me... I don't want to lose Est...

speaker: Abel
text: Est...

speaker: Marth
text: Abel!? Why are you... I don't believe this, you're betraying your homeland!?

speaker: Abel
text: Lord Marth... Please forgive me... They took Est... If I didn't fight... They would kill her. ...But after meeting your highness, I can no longer... fight... against Altea... Est... I'm sorry, please forgive me!!

speaker: Est
text: Abel... I’m sorry, you must have suffered.

speaker: Abel
text: Est!! You’re safe.

speaker: Est
text: Yes, Lord Marth rescued me. I’m alright now.

speaker: Abel
text: Really...? Damn, Archanea... But how should I apologize to Lord Marth…?

speaker: Est
text: I’m sorry... It was all because of me.

speaker: Abel
text: No, Est! It was nothing to do with you!! Those fools... I won’t forgive them... I’ll show them how deep my anger is!!

speaker: Eibel
text: What! Being able to defeat my great army. Are you even human?

speaker: Eibel
text: My Archanea army could be defeated...?

speaker: Marth
text: That was a fierce battle. Is everybody alright?

speaker: Jagen
text: Don't worry, they have been awaiting this day for a long time.

speaker: Marth
text: Archanea's actions were too cold-hearted. They even had innocent citizens killed. How can I apologise to the citizens...? I only bring trouble to everybody... Perhaps I'm not fit to protect this country.

speaker: Jagen
text: No, your highness, you're wrong! Your highness, you have a gentle heart, so that is why no matter what hardships, we can endure them. We believe in your highness, so that is why we follow you. Your highness, please raise your spirit!! We still haven't reclaimed Altea castle. There are probably many enemies awaiting us, but this is our castle. We already know how to fight this battle. Well, Lord Marth! Let's go!!

speaker: Marth
text: What's going on...? Even thieves have managed to find their way in. Could the Geosphere have been taken by them!?

speaker: Jagen
text: Your highness, a suspicious thief is escaping towards the north. We should send somebody in pursuit before it's too late.

speaker: Marth
text: Mmm, but we can't use horses or Pegasi inside, so what should we do...

speaker: Astram
text: You foul traitors! Taste the might of my Mercurius!

speaker: Astram
text: Midia...

speaker: Jeorge
text: Astram, how are you doing?

speaker: Astram
text: So it's the traitor, Jeorge. What do you want with me?

speaker: Jeorge
text: Wait, Astram. General Eibel has already fallen. You won't be able to win even if you continue fighting.

speaker: Astram
text: You want me to surrender...? Never! Even if I am the last one standing. I am a warrior of Archanea to the end!!

speaker: Jeorge
text: Why are you... Who are you fighting for? Are you fighting for Emperor Hardin?

speaker: Astram
text: No! It's not because of that man, but because of Nyna... And for Archanea!!

speaker: Jeorge
text: But, did Nyna tell you to fight here? Do you really think that Nyna would hope for this kind of battle?

speaker: Astram
text: Well... I hadn't seen Nyna for a while. I was told that she fell ill, and that I couldn't see her. But... Since Hardin is Emperor of Archanea, I have no choice. If I don't follow his orders I will become a traitor, and I will be betraying Nyna.

speaker: Jeorge
text: Astram, Nyna already entrusted the Emblem to Prince Marth. Do you understand the meaning of her actions?

speaker: Astram
text: Wh-what!! When did this happen, Jeorge? Nyna requested Prince Marth for help?

speaker: Jeorge
text: I believe that is the only explanation. Astram, if you want to find out the truth then come with us... If you die here, what will Midia do? You must live on, for her. You must live on, so you can confirm with your eyes what is happening.

speaker: Astram
text: Hmm... I guess I have no choice. But, Jeorge. If this war is as Hardin said, and was caused by Prince Marth's ambitions. I will never forgive you! Remember that!!

speaker: Willow
text: Hahaha... It's time for me to show you... The destructive power of my Meteor magic...

speaker: Willow
text: Emperor Hardin, forgive me...

speaker: Jagen
text: Prince Marth. The enemies in the castle have been vanquished. Altea is finally in our hands again.

speaker: Marth
text: Really? That's great. But, I stil don't see my sister...

speaker: Gotoh
text: Your highness, Princess Elice was taken by Gharnef.

speaker: Marth
text: Huh? Gotoh, is that true!?

speaker: Gotoh
text: He ordered the dark priests to search for clerics of noble birth. Lena, Maria... and even your sister Elice. They have all been taken by Gharnef...

speaker: Marth
text: Is that so... But what is he planning on doing by capturing them?

speaker: Gotoh
text: That I don't know, but I bet it's not anything good. The chain of events so far was all the doing of Gharnef.

speaker: Marth
text: Gotoh! Where is he now?

speaker: Gotoh
text: I don't know, but I bet Gharnef's next target will be Princess Nyna. So he is probably at Millennium Court...

speaker: Marth
text: I see. We will go to Millennium Court. I will rescue Hardin from the Darksphere's influence. I will defeat Gharnef and the dark priests... And I will rescue the captured clerics!!
